loans.name: Sonkoma Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SONKOMA VI   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOGODABA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  BAKORO 1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the SONKOMA VI group are married women who are, on average, 31 years old with three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Togodaba, one of the villages of the commune of Fakola (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Bakoro, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate two hectares (4.9 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her own village and in Fakola. She is expecting to make a profit of 145,500 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the growing season.

loans.name: Dúo Rosas Del Sargento Group

texts.es:
DUO ROSAS DEL SARGENTO

DUO CONFORMADO POR DOÑA MARIA ANGELA DE 36 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADA Y TIENE UN HIJO, ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE,SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE MARRANOS Y POLLOS. ELLA LUCHA DIARIAMENTE Y APROVECHA EL AREA DONDE VIVE, YA QUE ES UN LUGAR APTO PARA LA CRIANZA DE ESTOS ANIMALES QUE IGUALMENTE TIENEN MUCHA DEMANDA EN EL AREA.ELLA COMPRA LOS ANIMALES PEQUEÑOS Y CUENDO YA ESTAN GRANDES LO VENDE A UN MEJOR PRECIO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE SOLICITA A KIVA/FAPE Y ES UNA BONITA OPORTUNIDAD PARA CRECER EN SU NEGOCIO ATRAVES DEL CREDITO SOLICITADO YA QUE DESA COMPRAR CERDOS, POLLOS, CONCENTRADO, DESPARASITANTES Y VITAMINAS.ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO SOLICITADO.
texts.en:
ROSAS DEL SARGENTO DUO

María Ángela, 36, is part of this duo.  She’s married and has a son.  She’s from San Martín Jilotepeque and works raising pigs and chickens.  She strives daily and takes advantage of the area where she lives since it’s apt for raising these animals which are also in high demand in the area.

She buys the animals when they are little and when they grow big she sells them for a better price.  This is her first loan request to Kiva/Fape and it’s a lovely opportunity to grow in her business by means of the requested loan because she wants to buy pigs, chicks, feed, parasite remedies and vitamins.  She hopes that she can be helped with the loan she’s requested.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Nenette

texts.en:
Nenette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy food and household goods like chips, bread, milk, eggs, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Nenette has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from selling fish.

Nenette has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy food and household goods like chips, bread, milk, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sonkoma Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SONKOMA VII   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOGODABA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz  avec MAWA 1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 170.250FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the SONKOMA VII group are married women who are, on average, 33 years old with three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Togodaba, one of the villages of the commune of Fakola (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Mawa, a member of the group, grows rice. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate two hectares (4.9 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village and in Fakola. 

She is expecting to make a profit of 170,250 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the growing season.

loans.name: Lusvin Ramiro

texts.es: Lusvin de 33 años de edad soltero vive en Amatitlan Guatemala el se dedica a la venta de produtos de usos dometicos el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 año todavia no tiene la oportunidad de contar con un local propio donde exivir su mercaderia entonces su punto de ventas es en su casa es el primer credito que solicita y lo utilizara en la compra de mas mercaderia en productos de usos domesticos ya que la demanda de sus clientes es bastante y no alcanza satisfacer sus necesidades el espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que el anhelo de Él es aumentar su mercaderia y tener un local para exivir sus productos ya que de esa forma es como el sueña su futuro.
texts.en:
Lusvin, 33, is single living in Amatitlan, Guatemala.  He works selling home use products and has been in this business for three years.  He still does not have a place of his own in which to display his merchandise so his sales point is his home.

This is his first loan request and he will use it to buy more home use merchandise because customer demand is high and he’s unable to meet their needs.  He hopes that you will be able to help him with the loan he’s requested because his hope is to increase his merchandise and to have a place to display his products since this is how he dreams of his future.

loans.use: to buy home use items to sell.

loans.name: Norma Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 61 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció pero de esta relación tienen siete hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, aunque una de ellos vive muy cerca de ella. 

Doña Norma trabaja en un Municipio de la localidad y también se dedica al comercio, ella desde hace cinco años surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, la misma que ah ido aumentado poco a poco con los créditos que ha recibido. Cuando ella esta laborando en el Municipio su hija es la que se encarga de administrar la tienda y por este trabajo  le paga un sueldo semanal, con lo cual ella también se gana algo por su esfuerzo.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar y otros víveres que su tienda necesita para la satisfacción de los clientes, esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jardín De La Artesanía" ["Handicrafts Garden"] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial history and for its handicrafts, recognized on the national and international levels. It is the home of the famous hats made of paja toquilla fibers.

In this place lives Norma, who is 61 years old. A few years ago, her beloved husband passed away, but from this relationship she has seven children, who are already grown and independent, although one of them lives very close to her. 

Norma works for a municipality in her area, and she also dedicates herself to commerce. Five years ago, she opened a small grocery store in her home. Since then, it has grown little by little with the loans she has received. When she is working for the municipality, her daughter is the one who takes charge of managing the store, and for this work Norma pays her a weekly salary, thus allowing her to earn something for her efforts as well. 

This loan is to buy rice, sugar and other grocery items which her store needs to satisfy its customers. Norma has been in the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help provided to her through the loans. 

Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other grocery items.

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en:
Annalou is 39 years old and married with three children.

Annalou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

Annalou has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Annalou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Las Flores De Sija Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos es soltera, tiene 29 años de edad, de educación primaria completa, se dedica a la crianza de cerditos, inició este negocio criando gallinas ponedoras y de engorde y hasta la fecha lleva 6 años de expériencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de cerditos y también concentrado para alimentarlos, espera en el futuro contar con una grnaja con diferente tipo de ganado; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a crianza de animales, comercio venta de ropa y tienda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Santos is single.  She’s 29-years-old and completed primary school.  She works raising piglets.  She started the business raising laying and meat hens and to date has six years’ experience.  She can count on her family’s support.

She organizes a group and requests a loan that she’ll use to buy piglets and also concentrate to feed them.  She hopes in future to have a farm with different kinds of livestock.  The other group members work raising animals, selling clothes and selling groceries.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Sonkoma Viii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SONKOMA VIII   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOGODABA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec MINATA SIDI 1ère assise à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the SONKOMA VIII group are married women who are, on average, 36 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Togodaba, one of the villages of the commune of Fakola (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Minata Sidi, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village and in Fakola.

She is expecting to make a profit of 85,500 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the growing season.

loans.name: Mercedes Arelita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos   aún vive con ella. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Mercedes al ver que en ocasiones su marido no tiene trabajo  se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque también vende en su casa, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella compra su mercadería en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja cada vez que necesita más prendas, lleva más de 15 años en este negocio el cual lo empezó con el primer créditos que recibió del banco por eso está muy agradecida ya que gracias a esto ellos salen adelante cuando la situación es muy difícil.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y todo tipo de prendas que ella vende, esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que hoy le permite salir adelante.

Su sueño es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jardín De La Artesanía meets biweekly in Cantón Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are renowned nationally and internationally. The famous Panama hat comes from here.

This is where Mercedes lives. She is 54 años years old, married, and has three children from this marriage. They are all adults now, but the youngest still lives with her. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Since her husband doesn't have work at times, Mercedes works as a merchant, selling all kinds of clothing. She makes her sales door to door, but also at home. She leaves her merchandise with her customers on credit and bills them weekly. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil, a city where she travels every time she needs more clothing items. She has been in business for fifteen years. She started it using the first loan she got from her bank, which is why she is very grateful, since it allowed them to get through very difficcult times. 

This loan is to purchase pants, blouses, and all sorts of clothing items that she sells. She has been with her communal bank from the start and enjoys it because with the first loan she received from it she started the business that now allows her to get ahead.

Her dream is to have a store to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and all kinds of clothing items.

loans.name: Maximiliano Guillermo

texts.es:
Maximiliano, requiere optar por un nuevo prestamo porque necesita mas capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su actividad agropecuaria.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, veneno, entre otros y preparación de la tierra; esto le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario  para la siembra de maíz y así generar mayores ingresos para el hogar.
Las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado gracias al credito anterior.
texts.en: Maximiliano needs to take out another loan because he needs more capital to continue investing in his agricultural activity.  The loan he’s requesting will make it possible for him to buy agricultural supplies like manure and poison, among others and to prepare the soil.  This will help him have everything needed to plant corn and to generate higher household income.  Economic conditions and his family circumstances have improved thanks to the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dushigikirane Group

texts.fr:
Noëlla fait partie du groupe Dushigikirane  et habite à  Gitega. C’est une veuve de 36 ans .Elle a 7 enfants.
  
Elle fait le commerce de cacahouètes depuis 10  ans. 

Elle est à son vingtième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de cacahouètes  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Le gain de son commerce lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille (nourriture, habillement, logement,...)et elle a déjà acheté une  parcelle.
texts.en:
Noëlla is a member of the Dushigikirane group and she lives in Gitega.  She is a 36-year-old widow and the mother of seven children.

She has been selling peanuts for the past ten years.

This is her 20th loan with Turame.  With this loan, received from KIVA, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of peanuts for resale, in order to make more money.

With the earnings from her business,  Noëlla is able to meet her family's needs (food, clothes, housing...) and she has already bought a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Paccha  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Paccha está formado por 2 socios y 6 socias quienes viven en el cantón Nabón, este lugar es de un clima frió, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza y hermosos paisajes, su gente  es amable y gentil que luchan para mejorar su situación económica para sacarles adelante a sus familias,  se dedican a varias actividades como la agricultura, la crianza de animales y también laboran en la ciudad.  Su orgullo es aun mantener viva su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo está en el colegio, sus tres hijos siguientes estudian en una escuelita de la localidad y su último hijo pasa en casa ya que es aún muy pequeño. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de propia.

Doña Rosa pasa la mayor de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas para la venta y para el consumo de su casa, también cría borregos, vacas, cerdos y gallinas.

El dinero de su crédito va ha invertir en la compra de cerdos, gallinas, alimento para animales y semillas.

Su meta es tener un galpón más grande para criar sus pollos.
texts.en:
The “Paccha” communal bank consists of two male and six female members living in Nabón Canton.  This is a cold climate place.  It has several spots to enjoy nature and beautiful scenery.  Its residents are kind and gracious people who strive to improve their economic situation to move their families forward.  They carry out various activities like agriculture, animal husbandry and some also work in the city.  They pride is keeping their culture and traditions still alive.

One of this group’s members is Rosa, 33.  She’s married and has conceived six children.  Her first son is married and lives independently.  Her second son is in secondary school and her next three children attend the little local elementary school; her youngest is still at home because he’s still very little.  Her husband works in construction and the house they live in is theirs.

Rosa spends most of her time caring for her children but in order to contribute to household economy she works in agriculture.  She grows vegetables to sell and for home consumption.  She also raises sheep, cows, pigs and chickens.

She will use the money from her loan to buy pigs, chickens, animal feed and seeds.  Her goal is to have a larger chicken coop.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, feed and seeds.

loans.name: Princesas (Princesses) Group

texts.en:
As the president of this group explains, “we are going to name the group Princesas (Princesses), because each one of us will be a princess now that we will be able to improve our business”. 

The Princesas are enthusiastic hard-working women located in Ciudad Vieja, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. Within the group is a large variety of businesses including a tortillería (a tortilla shop), buying and selling clothes and catalog products,a first necessity store, soda sales, a beauty parlor and specialty meat sales.

37 year-old Aura Celina is a married woman with four kids; two of them go to school and the other two are under school age. Her husband is a construction worker who is sporadically employed depending on demand. Aura Celina has a 3rd grade education.She has been operating a business selling visceras (liver, intestines, tripe and other types of specialty meat) for the last five years.

Aura Celina leaves her home with her two young children in tow at 6 a.m. four days a week to make the 3 mile trip to sell her meat. Pulling a wheel barrel full of visceras, she explains, “I still have two more kids to go to school and I need this business to grow so I can have enough profit to be able to support their education”. 

She adds, “I need business education because I have been selling my product for five years and I have no written account of my expenses and profits and I have to be more organized”. Aura Celina has noticed that her business has the ability to grow if she had more product to sell. There is also demand for her to sell a mix of chopped vegetables such as tomato, onion and potato, which is used to prepare the food made with visceras. 

She plans to buy a scale as well for accurate measurement when she both buys and sells. Her current monthly profit is Q1,260 (US$164), averaging $2.56 per hour. She wants to increase her income to Q1,834 (US$238) by adding more product and increasing her inventory. Due to the demands of her children and household, she currently cannot increase her hours. Therefore, she is hopeful that by increasing her offerings, she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a scale and increase her inventory of meats and vegetables

loans.name: Sabali  I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABALI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJAN, un des villages de GARALO-Préfecture de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  DIATOUDJAN  1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1.5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à DEFINA et à KOLONDIEBA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 115.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the SABALI I group are married women who are, on average, 39 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Djan, one of the villages of the GARALO commune, in the Cercle of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Diatoudjan, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village, as well as in Defina and Kolondieba.

She is expecting to make a profit of 115,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the growing season.

loans.name: Futuro Para El Bien Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Futuro Para el Bien
Gregoria de 40 años es miembro del grupo. Ella es casada y tiene 02 hijos, se dedica a la confección y  venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, en la actualidad tiene su negocio en su casa donde sus clientes acuden a comprar los diferentes modelos que ella ofrece, también confecciona ropa a medida y hace arreglos de composturas. Gracias a su trabajo colabora con los gastos familiares y ayuda para que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación, ha solicitado este crédito para aumentar su negocio con la compra de casacas, buzos y polerones, quiere aprovechar esta época de invierno donde esos productos son muy requeridos, mas adelante quiere volver a tener un puesto de venta en un  mercado de su zona. Gregoria está feliz por su préstamo y muy agradecida que existan personas desinteresadas que invierten con personas como ella y su grupo comunal.
Gregoria es la última de la izquierda, viste casaca negra.
texts.en:
This is the “Futuro Para el Bien” (Future for Good) group.  Gregoria, 40, is one of the members.  She’s married and has two children.  

She works making clothes for women and men and currently her business is home-based; her customers come by her house to buy the various models she sells.  She also makes clothes to order and does repairs and tailoring.  Thanks to her work she’s able to contribute to household expenses and helps her children to have a good education.  

She’s requested this loan to increase her business with the purchase of jackets, sweatshirts and sweaters.  She wants to take advantage of the winter season when these types of items are in high demand.  Later on she wants to have a market stand again.  

Gregoria’s happy with her loan and very grateful that impartial people exist who invest in people like her and in her communal group.  Gregoria is last on the left wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. El trabajo que desempeña actualmente, es el de ordenanza en la alcaldía; anteriormente sus ingresos dependían de la agricultura y ganadería.

Hace aproximadamente 2 años ha instalado un puesto de venta junto con su esposa enfrente de la alcaldía, su esposa es quien lo administra. Según, comenta el negocio es bueno y esta saliendo adelante, pero necesita hacerle algunos cambios y mejoras. Por tal razón el préstamo que esta solicitando  a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más mesas, sillas y más productos.

Con el sueldo que gana como ordenanza, solo les alcanza para la comida del hogar y algunos gastos Y no tiene el dinero libre o suficiente para invertir en el negocio. Con la ampliación del comedor, llegaran mas clientes, mejoran sus ingresos y obtener mas ganancias y cubrir muchas necesidades dentro del hogar

Planea, buscar un local más grande para el negocio; ya que en el que esta es solo una media champa de lámina, en el cual los clientes estén más cómodos y así obtener más clientes y mejores ingresos y al jubilarse tener su negocio y poder administrarlo
texts.en:
Miguel is 54 years old. He is married and has one child. The work he is currently doing is as a messenger for the local government. Previously, his income depended on farming and raising livestock.

Approximately two years ago, together with his wife, he set up a stand in front of the town hall. His wife is the one who manages it. He comments that the business is good and it is making progress, but he needs to make some changes and improvements. For that reason, the loan that he is requesting from the Campo Foundation is to buy more supplies and more tables and chairs. 

The salary he earns as a messenger is only enough to pay for food for his household and some expenses. He does not have enough money available to invest in the business. With the expansion of the eating area, more customers will come, and Miguel and his wife will increase their income, obtain more profits and cover many necessities within their household. 

He plans to look for a larger location for the business, since the current one is only under half of a roofing sheet. With a larger location, his customers will be more comfortable, and thus he will obtain more customers and a better income, and when he retires he will have his business and will be able to manage it.

loans.use: to buy supplies and more tables and chairs.

loans.name: Sibonisiwe

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Sibonisiwe from Bulawayo. She is married, and she and her husband have four children, of whom three attend school.

Sibonisiwe runs a retail business selling footwear and clothes. The business has been in operation for 4 years. She gets most of her stuff from outside the country. She says the main challenges she faces are stiff competition when it comes to prices and also exorbitant import duty taxes. 

Sibonisiwe has requested a loan of $500 to order a variety of product stock and increase her business capacity. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her more income to buy food, and to pay rentals and fees for the children in school. In the future, Sibonisiwe plans to open more stalls around town and a clothes boutique.

loans.use: to replenish stocks of clothes, footwear, and blankets, and to purchase new items for winter.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo tiene 52 años de edad y casado, él saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por  ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo, quinua, maíz, etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 52 years old and is married.  He helps his family progress with great effort and dedication through his work, which is in farming.  He has several plots of farmland where he grows different crops, including potatoes, barley, wheat, quinoa, corn, and others.  

He has had this business for several years and it is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into it.  He belongs to the communal bank "Santa Ana" and at this time he needs a loan to buy seeds.

He is grateful and appreciates this loan and promises to make his monthly payments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: buy seeds.

loans.name: Esmerita

texts.en:
Esmerita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 13 years. She earns additional income from pottery, bamboo furniture, and gravestone making.

Esmerita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy equipment for the maintenance of her bicycle business. She hopes to repair and renovate her home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for the maintenance of her bicycle business

loans.name: Sabali Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABALI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJAN, un des villages de GARALO-Préfecture de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  KOROTOUMOU 2ème debout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1.5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à  DEFINA et à KOLONDIEBA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 115.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the SABALI II group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Djan, one of the villages of the GARALO commune, in the Cercle of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Korotoumou, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village, as well as in Defina and Kolondieba.

She is expecting to make a profit of 115,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the growing season.

loans.name: Sabali Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABALI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJAN, un des villages de GARALO-Préfecture de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec SETOU 2ème assise à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 1.5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village,  à  DEFINA et à KOLONDIEBA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 115.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the SABALI III group are married women who are, on average, 39 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Djan, one of the villages of the GARALO commune, in the Cercle of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Setou, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the front row, second from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village, as well as in Defina and Kolondieba.

She is expecting to make a profit of 115,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the growing season.

loans.name: Sabali Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABALI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJAN, un des villages de GARALO-Préfecture de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec SALIMATA 1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 0.5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à  DEFINA et à KOLONDIEBA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the SABALI III group are married women who are, on average, 39 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Djan, one of the villages of the GARALO commune, in the Cercle of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Salimata, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village, as well as in Defina and Kolondieba.

She is expecting to make a profit of 55,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Jovanny Janeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Jovanny, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos   aún vive con ella. Su esposo es jubilado.

Doña Jovanny es maestra de un colegio de la localidad, pero al ver que el sueldo muchas veces no alcanza para los gastos también se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que ella vende en el centro de estudios donde labora y los fines de semana y noches recorre su localidad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar algo extra.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 3 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para su vida.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jardín De La Artesanía" ["Handicrafts Garden"] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized on the national and international levels. It is the home of the famous hats made out of paja toquilla fibers.

In this place lives Jovanny, who is 52 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has four children, which are already adults. The youngest of them still lives with her. Her husband is retired. 

Jovanny is a teacher in a local school, but realizing that her salary often does not cover her expenses, she also dedicates herself to commerce. She sells clothing of all types as well as Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day, since she sells at the educational center where she works, and during evenings and weekends she goes around in the area where she lives. She offers her products on credit and collects payments every eight days. She has done this work for five years, and it has allowed her to earn a little extra. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing. She has been in the communal bank for three years, and she likes it because the loans are of great help in her life. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 29 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for seven years.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional seed and fertilizer for her business. She has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF, to sustain her vegatable-farming activity. Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed and fertilizer for her vegetable-farming business

loans.name: Francisca Mariel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 18 y 11  años de edad, la mayor estudia en Universidad y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.
 
Doña Francisca es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a solventar los gastos que generan su hogar se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Avon (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta en sus ratos libres, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella lleva varios meses en este negocio que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos Lleva más de 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Jardín De La Artesanía (Garden of the Crafts) meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally, the place of the famous Panama hats.

Francisca lives here. She is 38 years old, married and has two children ages 18 and 11; the oldest studies in university and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is an artisan.

Francisca is a very good mother and wife who sells Avon products (perfumes, creams, costume jewellery among other things) in order to help cover household expenses. She sells door to door in her free time, selling on credit and receiving payment every eight days. She has been doing this business for several months and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy creams, perfumes, costume jewellery and cosmetics. She has been in the Communal Bank for more than 6 years and she likes it because the loans are quick and without so many requirements. 

Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, costume jewellery and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosalia works hard to support her family. She has a business, buying and selling coconut wine, in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store, and from photography. 

Rosalia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Dúo Pachali Group

texts.es:
Dúo El Manzanillo, 
Integrada por la señora Lubia de 27 años de edad casada y tiene 2 hijos vive en una aldea de Santiago Sacatepequez, su esposo trabaja como jardinero, Lubia se dedica a la venta de ropa intima Blúmer, ropa para niños, trajes. También como actividad secundaria vende cosméticos, cremas para el cuerpo, shampo, se dedica ha estas actividades desde hace cinco años,todavia no tiene la oportunidad de tener un local donde exibir su mercaderia, entonces el punto de venta de ella es en su casa ya y como la aldea donde ella vive es pequeña entonces tiene la oportunidad de que sus vecinas la conoces y saben donde pueden encontrar su negocio, es primera ves que solicita credito en Kiva/Fape y espera que la puedan ayudar ya que Kiva se a caracterisado por ayudar a muchas personas y que poco a poco se han superado en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "El Manzanillo" duo includes Lubia, who is 27 years old.  She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She lives in the town of Santiago Sacatepequez.  Her husband works as a gardener.  Lubia works selling Bloomer intimate apparel for women, children's clothes, and suits.  In addition, she sells cosmetics, body creams, and shampoo.  She has been working in this area for 5 years.  As of yet, she hasn't had the opportunity to have her own shop to show her merchandise.  She currently sells from her house.  Since the town where she lives is small, she has the opportunity to get to know her neighbors so they can know where to find her business.

This is her first Kiva/Fape loan and she hopes that they can help her, since Kiva has become known for helping many people progress their businesses.

loans.use: buy intimate apparel for women, children's clothes, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Né vers 1966 à DIVO en RÉPUBLIQUE DE COTE-D’IVOIRE, elle réside à Kolondièba - ville (Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) avec ses 7 enfants et son mari dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Madame SALIMATA s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  pagnes wax et produits divers (parures, parfums, des œufs etc.).  Elle est très sollicitée au marché et surtout le jour de foire. 
Fort de ses 10 années d’expériences dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir remboursé le précédent. 
SALIMATA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes et des colis de parures. Elle s’approvisionne en (RCI) et chez les grossistes à Kolondièba ville. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit au marché, en famille et de façon ambulante à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
SALIMATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1966 in Divo, in the Republic of Côte d'Ivoire, Salimata now resides in the town of Kolondièba (prefecture of the third administrative region of Mali).  She lives with her husband and her seven children in a traditional family.

Salimata developed an interest for income-generating activities at an early age.  She became particularly interested in buying and selling wax "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) as well as various other goods (jewelry, perfumes, eggs etc.)  Her products are in high demand, especially on market days.

With ten years of experience in her field, she is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso in order to boost her business and meet the needs of an increasing number of customers.  She has repaid a previous loan and is now taking her second loan.

Salimata plans to use her loan to buy ten sets of "pagnes" and some boxes of jewelry.  She buys her merchandise in the Republic of Côte d'Ivoire and from wholesalers in the town of Kolondièba.  She sells for cash and on a retail basis, and sometimes for credit, at the market.  She also sells with her family and door to door.  Her customer base consists of men and women.

Salimata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, which will be used to meet her family's needs and to repay her loan. Part of her profits will also be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as ten sets of "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and some boxes of jewelry.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years, and she earns additional income from businesses in which she buys and sells coconut wine and firewood.

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts, for the maintenance of her bicycle and sidecar used in the business. Ma. Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her transportation bicycle

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 40 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rhoda has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from fish vending and selling frozen products.

Rhoda is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig raising business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Rosaura earns additional income from food vending and farming fruit trees.

Rosaura is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig raising business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. Rosaura dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elizabeth has been farming vegetables for 35 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Al-Hana Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hana and is comprised of six women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. This community is hardworking, and they work as much as they can in order to offer better living conditions. They took out a loan of 260,000 YER. 

Alfia is the leader of the group. She is a married woman, and she is 43 years old. She lives with her children in Sana`a, Yemen. She has a small house. She went through a lot of effort and had to save money with her family, to set up her house. She is aiming to complete her house. Alfia's share of the group loan is 50,000 YER, and she will use it to buy construction supplies for her business. She hopes with this loan to get more profit, so that she can expand her business for improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her business.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 43 years old and has five children, four of whom are in school. Lea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood.

Lea requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, eggs, etc. She has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. 

Lea aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Yessenia Colombia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Yessenia, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y  tiene tres hijos de 20, 17 y 11  años de edad, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Ella aprendió corte y confección solo con práctica pero no cuenta con un certificado de artesana.
 
Doña Yessenia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y sacarle adelante a su familia, ella tiene un taller de costura en  su casa donde se dedica a confeccionar ropa más que todo ropa deportiva para instituciones educativas de la ciudad, también elabora todo tipo de ropa para personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa ya que conocen la calidad de su trabajo, lleva  5 años dedicada a esta labor con la cual saca adelante sola a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas, cierres y otros materiales más que ella necesita para confeccionar sus prendas. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Jardín De La Artesanía (Garden of the Crafts) meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally; the place of the famous Panama hats.

Yessenia lives here. She is 39 years old, a single mother and has three children ages 20, 17 and 11; the two youngest go to school. She learned cutting and tailoring by practicing but doesn't have a certification.

Yessenia is a very hard working woman who likes to be self-sufficient and to get her family ahead. She has a sewing workshop in her house where she makes clothes mostly sports clothing and school clothing in the city. Also, she makes all types of clothing for people who go to her house since they know the quality of her work. She has been doing this work for 5 years which helps her to support her children on her own.

This loan is to buy threads, fabrics, fasteners and other materials that she need to make her garments. She has been in the Communal Bank for five cycles and she likes it because the loans are a great help. 

Her dream is that her children finish their studies and become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy threads, fabrics, fasteners and other materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 32 years old and has four children who are in school. She works in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marife has been pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

Marife requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Irma has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Irma is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 43 years old and has six children. She is married and one of her children is in school. Lolita is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lolita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy works hard to support her family. She is married and has an herbal oil business in the Philippines. Lucy has been in this business for five years now.

Lucy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional herbal oil products to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional herbal oil products to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has a pig raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pig raising business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through a past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pig

loans.name: Al-Abeer Group

texts.en:
Al-Abeer group consists of four females from Hodeidah, Yemen. 

Fatima, 32 years old, had to leave school in order to help her family. She has started her job making homemade Henna items like mixing of perfumes and creams which are used for brides. She sells her products to retailers and customers, as well as door to door. Any shortages of her products will cause her job to stop. That is why she has applied for a loan to buy the required Henna items to continue with her business. She hopes to earn a good income, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the required Henna items to continue with her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 41 years old and has four children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, and canned goods.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Emma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, and canned goods.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es madre soltera,  tiene un hija de tres años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella pudo con mucho esfuerzo terminar la secundaria. Actualmente se dedida a elaborar mantas con una maquina, sus productos son comercializados los dias jueves y domingos en la Zona 16 de Julio.
Necesita credito para comprar una maquina con tarjeta, de esa manera tendra innovaciones en su oferta y podra ofrecer a su clientela diferentes clases de mantas.
El sueño de Maria es distribuir sus productos a nivel nacional
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother.  She has a 3-year-old daughter and lives in her parents' home in Villa Tunari neighborhood, in the city of El Alto.  She worked very hard to finish high school.

Maria currently works making 'mantas' (a traditional textile used as a shawl or carrying cloth) by machine.  She sells her products on Thursdays and Sundays, in 16 de Julio district.

Maria needs this loan to buy a punch card knitting machine so that she can offer her customers new designs and types of 'mantas'.  

Maria's dream is to distribute her products nationally.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO or Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a punch card knitting machine for making 'mantas' (a traditional textile)

loans.name: Evelyn Nathaly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Evelyn, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de un año de edad. Su esposo es chofer, ella estudia Trabajo Social en una Universidad en Manta.

Doña Evelyn es una joven muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y forjarse un mejor porvenir para ella y su familia, además de estudiar su carrera universitaria también se dedica a vender ropa de todo tipo. Trabaja todos los días ya que ella vende en la Universidad donde estudia y en su casa en la cual tiene unas vitrinas donde muestra sus prendas, mientras ella sale a estudiar es su mamá la que le ayuda con su local ya que ella vive muy cerca y le ayuda cuidándole a su niña y su negocio. Ella tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito es para comprar todo tipo de ropa. Lleva 3 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda.

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Garden of Craftsmanship” Communal Bank meets each 15 days in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts which are recognized at the national and international level. This is the source of the famous “Panama” hats.

In this place lives Evelyn, 21 years old, who maintains a common law union from which she has a 1-year-old daughter. Her husband is a driver. She studies Social Work in a university in Manta.

Evelyn is a hard working young woman who values herself and wants to get ahead, forging a better future for her and her family. In addition to studying for her career in the university, she also sell clothing of all types. Evelyn works every day, selling at the university where she studies and from her house where she has some showcases for demonstrating her clothing. While she goes to class, her mother helps in the shop and lives very close by, helping care for her daughter and her business. Evelyn has sold clothing for 3 years, beginning with the 1st loan she received from the bank.

The present loan is for purchasing all types of clothing. Evelyn has been a member of her Communal Bank for 3 years and she likes it for its loans which are a great help.

Evelyn's dreams are to finish her studies and to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Nena requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials and spare parts for the maintenance of her business. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials and spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es madre soltera,  tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, ambos viven con la abuela del niño en casa de una prima (el alquiler es pagado por esta señora), la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto.
Maria solo hizo la secundaria, no pudo continuar sus estudios ya que no tenía los recursos económicos suficientes. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de refrescos de quinua y avena en sector de la Ceja de El Alto. 

Necesita crédito para adquirir  un terreno ubicado a unas cuadras  cerca de su actual domicilio. 

El sueño de María es tener una casa de dos pisos, asi podrá ofrecer a su familia mayor comodidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is the single mother of a 2 year-old child.  They live with the child's grandmother in a cousin's house (the rent is paid by the grandmother).  This house is located in the Villa Cooperativa neighborhood of the city of El Alto.

Maria only completed high school; she could not continue with her studies because she lacked sufficient resources.  She has a business selling drinks made from quinoa and oats on the street in the La Ceja neighborhood of El Alto.

She needs a loan to buy a plot of land located a few blocks from her current dwelling.

Maria's dream is to have a 2-story house.  This way, she could provide her family with greater comfort. 

This is the first time that Maria has requested a loan from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy some land

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Guillerma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and rice farming. Guillerma is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Guillerma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Merasol

texts.en:
Merasol is 33 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merasol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, coffee, and canned goods She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Merasol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, coffee, and canned goods.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rogiel

texts.en:
Rogiel is 63 years old, married and has six children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

Rogiel has been raising livestock for 23 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rogiel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Aiymkan

texts.ru: Айымкан, 60 лет, вдова.  Имеет 3 сыновей. С 2001 года занимается животноводством. Бизнес начала с 10 000 сом(KGS). Благодаря своим силам, на сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, а в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, и 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Ежемесячная прибыль Айымкан составляет 10000 сом(KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития и увеличения поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве Айымкан обратилась в наш микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 100 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку скота. На доходы от кредита Айымкан планирует построить дополнительный сарай для содержания скота.
texts.en: Aiymkan is a 60 year old widow with three sons. She has been raising livestock since 2001 when she started her business with 10,000 somoni. Thanks to her hard work she is now a successful farmer and has 3 milk cows, 1 calf, and 15 head of sheep and goats. Aiymkan earns 10,000 somoni per month. Her goal is to increase her number of livestock and expand her business. She took out a loan with Bai Tushum and Partners for 100,000 somoni in order to buy cattle and plans to build an additional cattle shed with her earnings.

loans.use: to buy cattle and to build an additional barn for cattle

loans.name: Benemerito Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Benemérito” está integrado por nueve personas, todos son vecinos de la misma comunidad es una comunidad muy bonita se caracteriza por su lago enorme. Los integrantes del grupo dicen que del lago pueden aprovechar para pescar sin ningún costo, también es una comunidad donde se caracteriza por sus enormes arboles, la fiesta más grande en la comunidad se celebra el 2 de Agosto, Día de Nuestra Señora de los Ángeles.

Doña Yola como le dicen de cariño tiene 38 años de edad está casada desde hace 20 años con el señor Raúl quien trabaja como albañil juntos han formado una familia con cinco niños. Doña Yola está solicitando el crédito para comprar artículos de mercería como bolitas, pinzas, moños, prendedores, pinzas para el cabello, cortaúñas, limas, ganchos etc. Es la primera vez en esta actividad nunca había tenido un negocio así, anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría, engorda y venta de pollos, pero ya no quiere continuar con la actividad porque se los comen los coyotes. Doña Yola tiene pensado vender sus artículos de mercería en la puerta de la iglesia los días domingos atenderá su negocio una de sus hijas mientras Doña Yola trabajara como empleada domestica. Ella está muy contenta porque iniciará con su negocio, no tenía dinero para invertir en sus productos pero gracias al crédito tendrá su negocio nuevo, gracias a esto ella podrá obtener más ganancias para su familia. La señora Yola desea tener un negocio propio en su casa y mas grande, todo con la única finalidad para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos quiere “Dos de mis hijos ya no quisieron seguir estudiando pero sí quiero que los otros tres niños los cuales son los que aun estan estudiando terminen de estudiar una carrera profesional” al igual que Doña Yola quiere superarse también los demás integrantes están solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en sus actividades económicas: 

Doña Marybel venta de mandiles y venta de flores
Trinidad en su estética
Elena en venta de mandiles
María y Rosa María en la cría de sus borregos
Aurea y Filiberto invertirán en sus becerros y alimento 
Teresa en la venta de dulces

Ellos están muy contentos y agradecidos con KIVA y VisionFund por la oportunidad de recibir su crédito.
texts.en:
The group "Benemerito" is made up of nine people. All of them are neighbors from the same community. It is a very beautiful community characterized by its enormous lake. The group members say that they can take advantage of the lake to fish for free. The community is also distinguished by its giant trees. The town's biggest holiday is celebrated on August 2, the day of Our Lady of the Angels. 

Doña Yola, as she is affectionately known, is 38, and has been married to Raul for 20 years. He works as a construction worker. Together, they have made a family with five children. Yola is asking for the loan to buy notions like marbles, clothespins, ribbons, brooches, hairpins, nail clippers, files, and hooks, etc. This is her first time doing this activity. She has never had a business like this one. Previously she worked raising, fattening, and selling chicken, but she doesn't want to stay in this line of work because coyotes eat the chickens. Yola is planning on selling her goods by the door of the church. On Sundays, her daughters will attend to her business while she works as a domestic employee. 

She is very glad she will start her business. She didn't have money to purchase her products, but thanks to the loan, she will have her new business. Thanks to this, she will be able to earn more income for her family. Yola wants to have her own, larger business in her home, with the ultimate goal of being able to help out with household expenses and the education that her children want. "Two of my children did not want to continue studying, but I want the other three children, who are still studying, to study a professional degree."

Just as Yola wants to better herself, the other group members are asking for a loan to invest in their economic activites: Marybel sells aprons and flowers, Trinidad has a beauty salon, Elena sells aprons, and Maria and Rosa Maria raise yearling sheep. Aurea and Filiberto will invest in their bull calves  and feed and Teresa will invess in her sweet sales. They are very glad and grateful to Kiva and VisionFund for the chance to get their loan.

loans.use: to buy notions and odds and ends.

location.town: Pueblo Nuevo de los Angeles, El Oro.

loans.name: Miraflores Group

texts.es:
En Tierra Blanca se ha formado un grupo de 5 personas alegres y amables. 
Georgina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 30 años, solo estudia la secundaria y esta casada con Irving que trabaja  como mecánico. Georgina platica que por mas de 5 años se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella inicio vendiendo casa por casa pero gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia ya es promotora y tiene a mujeres que trabajan vendiendo estos productos y gana por comisión sobre las ventas que ellas realizan.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que gana su propio dinero, ha hecho buenas amistades y es una empresa que le da la oportunidad de crecer.
Ella tiene una meta a corto plazo la cual es aumentar sus ventas para logar ganarse un auto que ofrece como premio la empresa cosmética para la que vende.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que trabaja muy dura lograr sus objetivos y a solicitado este crédito a VisionFund para invertir en la comprar de variedad de cosméticos (sombras, labiales, maquillajes, perfumes, delineadores, perfumes y esmaltes ).
Doña Georgina agradece el apoyo que se le esta brindando a ella y a su grupo con este crédito.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Teresa-Venta de Cosméticos
Alvaro-Servicio de taxi	
Rosalia-venta de lencería y colchas
Esmirna-Venta de colchas, zapatos y ropa.
texts.en:
In Tierra Blanca a group of five friendly and happy people has been formed.

Georgina is one of the members of this group. She is 30 years old and has only been educated to secondary level. She is married to Irving, who works as a mechanic. Georgina says that she has been selling cosmetics via catalogues for more than five years. She began by selling door to door but thanks to her effort and perseverance she is now a consultant and has women who sell these products and earn commission on the sales they make.

What she likes most about her business is that she earns her own money, she has made some good friendships, and it gives her the opportunity to grow.

Her short-term goal is to increase her sales in order to win the car the cosmetics company she sells for is offering as a prize.

She is a very enterprising woman who works very hard to achieve her objectives. She has requested this loan from VisionFund in order to invest in purchasing a variety of cosmetics (eye shadows, lipsticks, foundation, perfume, eyeliners, and nail polish).

Georgina is grateful for the support this loan will give her and her group.

The other members of the group are:
Teresa – cosmetics sales
Alvaro – taxi services
Rosalia – linen and bedspread sales
Esmirna – linen, shoes, and clothing sales

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, eyeliners, perfume, eye shadows, and foundation

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 51 years old, widowed, and has five children, one of whom attends school.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 28 years. 

Leonila is requesting a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de cuatro años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus tres hermanos mayores. El domicilio se encuentra en la zona de Villa Bolívar D de la ciudad de El Alto.
Miriam solamente es bachiller. Tiene un pequeño kiosco en el que comercializa chocolates y una gran variedad de golosinas en el Aeropuerto Internacional de El Alto.
El crédito es para comprar peluches y artesanías, aumentar su capital de trabajo le permitira incrementar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su pequeño.
El sueño de Miriam es tener una boutique en la que pueda ofrecer ropa de vicuña y variedad de artesanías bolivianas.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
