Miriam is a single mother who has a four-year-old child. She lives in her own home with her three older siblings. Her house is located in the District of Villa Bolívar D in the city of El Alto.

Miriam only has a high school education. She has a small kiosk where she sells chocolates and a wide variety of sweets at the international airport in El Alto. Her loan will be used to buy plush toys and handicrafts. This will increase her operating capital, which will allow her to earn more income and improve the quality of life for her little one.

Miriam’s dream is to own a boutique where she can offer clothing made of vicuña wool and a variety of Bolivian handicrafts. This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy plush toys and handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Aves De Paraíso Group

texts.es: Don Florencio tiene 49 años de edad, él pertenece a un grupo de personas que piden créditos para mejorar sus negocios y así poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, su grupo se llama Aves de Paraíso y dice que sus compañeros de grupo le platicaron que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que donde se reunían anteriormente había unas flores muy bonitas llamadas así. El es casado y tiene 5 hijos los cuales 3 van a la escuela ya que el mayor ya no quiso seguir estudiando y mejor se dedico a trabajar. Florencio por las mañanas se dedica a vender paletas de hielo y helados por las calles de su comunidad, dice que el no las hace nada mas las compra y se va a venderlas mas que nada afuera de las escuelas ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son niños, por la tarde el se dedica arreglar televisores en su casa ya que no tiene un local o hay veces que va hasta el domicilio de las personas que quieren que les arregle algún aparato electrodoméstico. Dice que el aprendió arreglar los aparatos por que un amigo de el lo invito a trabajar y a que aprendiera como componer los electrodomésticos y con el tiempo don Florencio decidió poner su propio negocio. El ahorita esta pidiendo ayuda a VisionFund para que pueda obtener un crédito para mejorar sus negocios ya que quiere surtir sus helados y paletas y comprar también barquillos y vasos de plástico para vender los helados, también quiere comprar varias refacciones y material que ocupa para dar un mejor servicio. La meta de don Florencio es seguir vendiendo sus helados y paletas y también poner en su casa un taller para arreglar los electrodomésticos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Isela, María Remedios, Cirenia, Socorro, Yaquelin, Marcela, Sandra, Maribel y Antolín ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de maíz para hacer tortillas a mano, leña, un comal, en la compra de material como madera, clavos para elaborar cajas de madera para la fruta, en la compra de artículos de tienda de abarrotes para surtirla, en la compra de dulces para surtir puesto, para la compra de materiales para construcción para su venta como tabique, arena, cemento etc, compra de pollos para engorda y alimento para estos.
texts.en: Florencio is 49 years old. He belongs to a group of people who take out loans to improve their businesses to be able to give their families a better quality of life. His group is called Aves de Paraíso and he says that the other members of the group told him they gave it that name because where they used to meet there were some very pretty flowers with that name. He is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are in school, since the oldest didn't want to go to school anymore and decided to start working. In the morning, Florencio sells popsicles and ice cream in the streets of his community. He says that he doesn't make them, he just buys them and sells them, mainly outside of schools, since most of his customers are children. In the afternoon, he fixes televisions in his home, since he doesn't have a locale. Sometimes people go to his house wanting him to fix an appliance. He says that he learned to fix appliances because a friend invited him to work and learn how to fix appliances and over time Florencio decided to start his own business. Now he is asking VisionFund for help so that he can get a loan to improve his businesses. He wants to stock up on ice cream and popsicles and also buy barquillos and plastic cups to sell the ice cream in. He also wants to buy different replacement parts and materials that he uses to give better service. Florencio's goal is to keep selling his ice cream and popsicles and also set up a workshop in his house to fix the appliances. The other members of the group are named Isela, María Remedios, Cirenia, Socorro, Yaquelin, Marcela, Sandra, Maribel and Antolín. They will invest their loans in buying corn to make handmade tortillas, firewood, a comal, in buying materials such wood and nails to make wooden crates for fruit, in buying store merchandise such as groceries, in buying candies as merchandise, in buying construction materials to sell such as bricks, sand, cement, etc., in buying chickens to raise and sell, as well as their feed.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and materials to repair appliances and to buy ice cream and popsicles.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. Tessie is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Tessie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins, feed and additional livestock for her business.

Tessie has been in this business for 30 years now.

Tessie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed and additional livestock for her business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married and the mother of nine children, seven in school. Leonila works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling water. Leonila is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Nora is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Nora has been pig fattening for 20 years and earns additional income from buying and selling nipa (palm for weaving).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cirila works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing and a general store. Cirila is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Cirila has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Macrina requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Macrina has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Macrina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Claudia Azucena

texts.es:
Claudia,  es madre soltera y disfruta de dos hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad, los cuales dependen de ella. Claudia, se dedica a la venta de ropa, inicia este negocio como una fuente  de apoyo económico para su familia, esto lo realiza de 7:00am a 5:00pm. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar diversidad de mercadería tales como: camisas, pantalones, chores, entre otros; esta inversion le ayudara a mejorar los inventarios, aumentar las ventas y con ello optimizar las ganancias.
Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is a single mother who enjoys raising her two children who are ages 6 and 8, who depend on her.  She started a business selling clothing in order to have a source of income to support her family.  She works from 7 am to 5 pm.

She is seeking this loan so that she can buy an array of merchandise, such as shirts, pants and shorts.  This investment will help her to improve her inventory, increase her sales, and optimize her profits.

Her dream is to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, shorts and other types of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina es soltera, todavia vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta nivel técnico medio egresando como secretaria ejecutiva. Actualmente trabaja en la Alcaldía de La Paz ene la área de Archivos.
El crédito es para mudarse a una habitación bajo modalidad de anticrético ya que sus padres harán modificaciones en su hogar y Lina tendra que vivir en otra parte.
El sueño de Lina es ter una casa propia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Lina is single and still lives in her parents' house located in the Ciudad Satélite zone of El Alto. She completed mid-level technical training and graduated as an executive secretary. She presently works for the city of La Paz in archives. The loan is so she can move into a room under an anticrético rental arrangement, since her parents will be making modifications on their home and Lina will have to live elsewhere. Lina's dream is to have her own house. This is the first time she has requested a loan with IMPRO and her first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to make a deposit on housing.

loans.name: Sreyny

texts.en:
Sreyny is 20 years old, married, and has one son. She lives in a village of the Dambae district, where she farms cassava and rubber tree. Sreyny earns additional income by working for others. She earns about 30,000 KHR a day. 

Sreyny is requesting her first loan from VisionFund for 1,000,000 KHR, which she will use to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy telephone call credit and candies

loans.name: Al-Akhlass Group

texts.en:
This group is called AL-Akhlass and consists of five women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 270,000 Yemen rials (YER) from AMB.

Nwal is 25 years old, is single, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a hairdresser whose customers are women. She has been talented from infancy to work in her field. She is an industrious individual who has been working for many years. Thanks to her efforts, she has acquired many customers. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB so that she can buy cosmetics for her business. She is grateful for the assistance she has received.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak is 26 years old and married with two children. To make a living, she has been farming rice, raising pigs, and planting cassava for several years in her village. Her current business earns her family about 36,000 KHR each day to feed their children.  

Sak is requesting her first VisionFund loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy rubber trees to grow to earn additional income for her family. She hopes her loan will enable her to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy rubber trees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Al-Nadham Group

texts.en:
The Al-Nadham group consists of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They work hard as much they can to offer a good life for their families. The group has taken out a loan of 300,000 Yemen rials (YER) from AMB. 

Elham is the leader of this group. She is 41 years old, is married, and has five children. She is a housewife who wants her children to grow up well and have a better education. She intends to buy supplies for her house, so she has applied for a loan of 80,000 YER to buy a fridge and washing machine for her house. She hopes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married parent of four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling Natasha products and pre-paid mobile phone card loads. Leah works hard to support her family. She has sustained her business with a previous NWTF loan.

Leah is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, spice, noodles, and other items. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, spice, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Sokhy's Group

texts.en:
Sokhy is 45 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are still in school. She lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and earns a living growing cassava and cashew. Sokhy has been in this business for seven years and she and her husband are able to earn about 47,000 KHR each day. She manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after her family’s daily expenses. Sokhy has been with VisionFund for six cycles and has completely repaid her previous loans which helped her improve her standard of living. 

Sokhy is the leader of a group loan request. She will use her portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. Sokhy hopes to increase her crop yield and make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer and clean his farm.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат, 29 лет, замужем, многодетная мать имеет 4 детей (4 дочери). Образование-среднее. После окончания средней школы Салтанат вышла замуж совсем в юном возрасте. С 2005 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 1 000 сом (KGS). Супруг Салтанат –пастух, пасет домашний скот жителей своего села. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанат, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 10 овец. Также в наличии имеет 0,43 ГА поливной земли и 0,22 ГА земельного надела.  Прибыль позволила Салтанат размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салтанат обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. Доходы от кредита Салтанат  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Saltanat is 29 years old, married and has four children, all daughters.  After graduating high school with a diploma, Saltanat married at a young age.  Since 2005, she has worked in agriculture and livestock, starting her business with 1,000 KGS.  Saltanat's spouse is a shepherd, herding the animals belonging to the people in their village.  Thanks to Saltanat's hard work, today she has many animals: two dairy cows, two calves, and ten sheep.  She also has .43 hectares of irrigated land, and an additional allotment of .22 hectares.  The profits from her efforts allow Saltanat to breed her animals and improve her family's circumstances.  With the goal of further business growth, she has turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy dairy cows.  The income provided by the loan will go towards expanding her herd.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Benkoro Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 5 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe BENKORO vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et nucléaires avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Kolondieba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, chaussures, de condiments, canaris et de pagnes wax. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame SALI (2ème à droite sur la photo) est la vendeuse de wax du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4pièces de pagnes wax.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame SALI compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Benkoro group is composed of five married women living in both traditional and nuclear families. On the average, they are 39 years of age, with five children. They all live in the town of Koldieba (a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali) and know each other as  neighbors or relatives by blood or marriage. The group members work as vendors selling shoes, condiments, “canaris” pottery containers traditional   “pagnes” wax cloth.
With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwas and are now on their second solidarity loan. Mrs. Sali (the second one  from the  right in the photo) is a group member who sells wax cloth. She plans to use her loan to buy four sets of cloth. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers and sells retail, for cash and on credit, out of her home and at the market, to a customer base composed of both men and women. Mrs. Sali plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 12,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in the business and help her husband with some family expenses.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth.

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en:
Thary is 29 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. Thary and her husband are farmers who grow rice and make palm juice. Having been in this business for ten years, together they can earn about 17,000 KHR each day. Thary has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She fully paid back her past loans which helped her better support her family and provide enough food.

Thary is the leader of a group requesting a 600,000 KHR loan for each person. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Thary hopes to expand her business and grow more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Savoeng's Group

texts.en:
Savoeng is 55 years old and widowed. She lives with five children in a rural area located in the Srey Snom district, Cambodia. Savoeng is a farmer who has grown rice and cassava for 34 years. With her current business, she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day to feed her family and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

Savoeng is requesting her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. She is the leader of a group loan request. Savoeng will use her portion of the loan to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Benedicto Antonio

texts.es: Benedicto tiene 9 años vendiendo productos diversos en las zonas cercanas a su comunidad. Él tiene una camioneta en la que transporta sus productos y va anunciando por las calles lo que ofrece para que los clientes se acerquen a comprar. Benedicto quiere un préstamo de $32,550 para comprar más productos como plátano, yuca, guineo, batata, yautía y cebolla y además quiere pagar el envío de una caja de ropas que recibió recientemente. Estas son inversiones que Benedicto le hace a su negocio para cumplir su objetivo más cercano de poder cambiar la camioneta por un camión de manera que pueda trabajar haciendo zonas de distribución.
texts.en:
Benedicto has been selling different products for nine years in the areas near his community. He has a truck that he uses to transport his products and to advertise himself on the streets with what he’s offering so that his customers can approach him to make purchases. Benedicto is requesting a loan of 34,550 DOP so that he can buy more products such as plantains, cassava, bananas, sweet potatoes, yautia (a root similar to taro), onions, and other items. He will also pay for a shipment of clothing that he recently received.

These investments that Benedicto has made in his business will help him move one step closer to his goal of replacing his truck with a larger vehicle so that he can begin working as a distributor.

loans.use: to buy a variety of produce to sell and to pay for a shipment of clothing.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly, a rural villager from Banteay Meanchey province's Mongkol Borey district, is 50 years old. She has earned a living through planting rice for 20 years. Ly is able to save up to 15,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day from her current business after deducting expenses.

This is the eighth cycle loan for Ly’s group of two with Kiva partner VisionFund. Ly is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her farming so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is 60 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. To feed their family, Lim and her husband have been farming rice for 32 years and earn about  63,000 KHR each day to spend on their family’s needs.

Lim is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund to buy rubber trees. This is her first loan. Lim hopes to increase her crop yields and generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rubber trees to plant

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret is 33 years old and married with two dependent children who are still in school. She lives with her family in a village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. For the last four years, Saret has been selling grocery items while her husband has been growing beans and corn. Together, they can earn about 27,000 KHR each day.  Saret has received her first microloan with VisionFund. 

Saret is requesting a 2,000,000KHR loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She will use a portion of her loan to buy more grocery items to resell. Saret hopes this loan will enable her to improve her crop yield, make a living better, and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Dambae district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Savet, 30, is a married mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava growing. She and her husband have been in this business for 10 years. The current business earns her about 28,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

This is the third loan for Savet with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she successfully used the past loan to relieve her family’s financial burden and increase the family’s income. With the need to support her business, she is requesting another loan of 2,000,000 KHR with VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sreyvong

texts.en:
Sreyvong is a 31-year-old married mother of three children who lives in a rural village of the Bovel district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice for almost seven years. Sreyvong’s current business earns her about 26,000 KHR each day to meet her family’s needs. She just began with VisionFund this cycle. 

Sreyvong is requesting a 3,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes that her loan will enable her to expand her crop yield and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es casado, su hijo cursa el nivel inicial en un colegio publico de El Alto, el vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ramiro tiene estudios de nivel tecnico superior en mecanica automotriz. Posee un taller donde desempeña sus funciones, el cuenta con un ayudante para terminar su trabajo lo antes posible , su esposa es vendedora de sandalias los dias martes y viernes en la zona de Rio Seco.
Necesita credito para equipar el taller
El sueño de Ramiro es abrir mas talleres de mecanica automotriz.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ramiro is married and has a son who is finishing his first level at a public high school in El Alto.

Ramiro lives at his parents’ house in the District of Mariscal Sucre in the city of El Alto. He finished his advanced level technical studies as an auto mechanic. Ramiro has a repair shop where he performs his work. He has one assistant who helps him to complete the work as quickly as possible. His wife sells sandals on Tuesdays and Fridays in the District of Rio Seco.

Ramiro needs this loan so that he can equip his repair shop. His dream is to open more auto repair shops. This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 32, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She has a child who is not yet in school. At this time, she is working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Rowena operates an Internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume and any office documentation, as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. 

Rowena hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to give a good future to her child. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to find strength and encouragement from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Mrs. Rina, 57 years old, lives with her sister and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has retired from work and gets a state pension. Not wanting to sit idle, seven years ago she began working as a sentry at a high school. Her son, together with his colleagues, make house decoration for a living. Her sister, same as her son, was raised by her, and now works as a cook at a restaurant. 

The house the family lives in is a small barn, and it barely withstands winter storms and frosts. She is requesting a loan of 5,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, bricks, cement, metal and sand. Using those materials, she wants to make a large extension to her barn, as her son is getting married. More importantly, they will reduce their coal consumption and contribute to the efforts against air pollution by releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere. 

In the future, she is dreaming about building a new house where she wants to live happily with her grandchildren. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: 3.4.311.15.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle with her business in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Van has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

Van is the group leader of the 3.4.311.15 Thieu Phuc solidarity group, which consists of five members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Vân is 54 years old and she is married, with three children. Two are grown up, so she supports one dependent.

In 2012, Vân joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her children to find a good job, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Baatarjav

texts.en:
Mr. Baatarjav, 54 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has worked for the military service for almost thirty years and recently retired from work. His family's income is composed of his retirement pension and his wife’s and son's salaries. 

In 2002, they moved to their current apartment, and since then they haven't made any repairs or added insulation to their home. So, he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass. He will replace the old windows and floors with more durable and quality ones. As a result, during wintertime, the frosts and storms won't chill down the family to its core. This way it will spare more energy and contribute to the environmental cause. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass.

loans.name: Dashdavaa

texts.en:
Mr. Dashdavaa, 20 years old, lives with his parents in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2011 and is contributing to the family’s income. His mother sells dairy products at a lower price than market price. His father travels a lot because of his profession as a building engineer and is currently working in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such shingles, bricks and planks in order to upgrade the house roof. The house roof has deteriorated over the years due to strong wind and snow, and it is the main gateway for heat loss from the house. So changing the roof will stop heat loss, and thus enable the family to burn less coal for heating. 

This will have a positive impact on the environment, as fewer air pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to purchase shingles, bricks and planks.

loans.name: Franklin Anastasio

texts.es: El señor Franklin tiene 49 años de edad. El es un pequeño productor de  una comunidad rural de Chinandega.  El tiene más de 30 años de trabajar en ganadería, empezó desde joven. Ahora se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca. Diariamente ordeña vacas y la traslada al pueblo más cercano en una moto recorriendo unos 30 kilómetros aproximadamente. Su esposa le ayuda a vender la leche en el pueblo. Este método de trabajo le ha permitido mantener a su familia y le ha permitido a sus hijos ir al colegio. Sin embargo ellos han vivido sin energía eléctrica. En su comunidad no llega la red eléctrica por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar un pequeño sistema solar. Así podrá ordeñar las vacas por las madrugadas y pasar en familia durante las noches.
texts.en: Franklin, 49, is a small producer in a rural community in Chinandega.  He’s been working raising cattle for more than 30 years; he started when he was very young.  Now he works producing cow’s milk.  He milks cows daily and transports the milk to the nearest town on a motorcycle; he travels about 30 kilometers approximately.  His wife helps him to sell the milk in town.  This way of working has made it possible for him to support his family and has allowed his children to attend school.  However, they have lived without electric energy.  The electric grid does not reach their community and this is why he’s asking for a loan to buy a small solar system.  In this way he’ll be able to milk the cows at dawn and spend family time at night.

loans.use: to buy a home solar light system.

loans.name: Caridad Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Caridad tiene 42 años de edad, vive con sus 4 hijos varones de los cuales 3 están estudiando y el otro hijo trabaja en una finca cercana.  Ella es madre soltera. Es padre y madre para sus hijos. El papá de los niños de vez en cuando le manda un poquito de dinero. Ella compra leche de vaca y produce con esta cuajada y crema en su casa y la vende en el pueblo más cercano. Ella lleva un poco más de tres años realizando esta actividad y así ha podido mejorar su humilde casa y comprar utensilios básicos como camas y sillas para sus hijos. También aprovecha el suero y se los da a cerdos que cría. Con esto obtiene otro pequeño ingreso. En la comunidad donde vive no hay energía eléctrica por lo que ella quiere obtener al crédito un pequeño sistema solar para poder iluminarse, cargar celular y escuchar la radio. Así ella se sentiría mas segura por las noches y también sus hijos podrían estudiar por las noches. Ella agradecería mucho la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Caridad, 42, lives with her four sons three of which are attending school and one who works for a nearby farm.  She’s a single mother; she’s both father and mother to her children.  Her children’s father sends her a little money once in a while.  

She buys cow’s milk and makes cream and curd from it at home and then sells it in the nearest town.  She’s been doing this activity for a little more than three years and has been able to make improvements to her humble abode and to buy basic furnishings like beds and chairs for her children.  She also takes advantage of the whey in that she uses it as feed for the pigs she raises to earn a little extra income.  

The community she lives in doesn’t have electricity which is why she wants to get a loan in order to obtain a small solar system so she can have light, to charge her cell phone and to listen to the radio.  She’d feel saver at night this way and her children would be able to study at night.  She would be very grateful for the opportunity of getting this loan.

loans.use: to buy a solar home lighting system.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: El señor Bernardino tiene 48 años. Vive desde hace más de 40 años en una comunidad rural que no tiene energía eléctrica. Desde hace 6 años trabaja en una finca en labores productivas. En la casa de la finca donde trabaja hay un panel solar. A él le gustaría tener un panel solar en su casa para que su familia pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. En su hogar viven diez familiares incluyendo a 3 hijos que van a la escuela y que se beneficiarían al poder realizar tareas en las noches y ver ciertos programas de televisión. El desea el crédito para vivir de otra manera, libre de oscuridad, con sus hijos y familia y no seguir usando candiles.
texts.en: Bernardino, 48, has lived in a rural community with no electricity for more than 40 years.  He’s worked on a farm doing productive work for the last six years.  At the house on the farm he works at there is a solar panel.  He’d like to have a solar panel at his house so that his family can improve their quality of life.  Ten family members including three children attending school live in his house and they would greatly benefit by being able to do their homework at night and being able to watch certain television programs.  He wants the loan so that he can live differently with his children and family, free of darkness, and no longer using oil lamps.

loans.use: to buy a home solar power system.

loans.name: Carmen Marina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, una de ellos  aún vive con ella. Su esposo tiene un taller que arregla zapatos.

Doña Carmen con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta además también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local bien surtido,  ella sale a recorrer tres días de la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y con esto ella ayuda a solventar los gastos ya que su marido no gana mucho con su labor.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jardín De La Artesanía" meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are well-known at the national and international level, because this is where the famous "Panama" straw hats are made.

This is where Carmen, 63, lives.  She is married, and she and her husband have three grown children, one of whom still lives with her.  Her husband has a workshop where he repairs shoes.

In order to earn something on her own so that she can get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses, Carmen has a business selling all types of clothing.  She sells door-to-door as well as from her home, where she has a small store that is well stocked.  Carmen goes out to sell three days a week, selling on credit and collecting every 15 days.  She goes to buy her merchandise in Guayaquil every time she needs it.  She's had this business for 9 years, and with it she helps to cover the household expenses, since her husband doesn't earn a lot from his work.

Carmen will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.  She's been a member of her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the help that is always provided with these loans, enabling her to get ahead.

Carmen's dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: El señor Máximo tiene 45 años de edad. El vive en una comunidad rural de matagalpa con su esposa y dos hijos. El es un pequeño productor de café y cacao. Hace poco a su esposa la beneficiaron con un programa de ayuda comunitaria donde le entregaron una vaca, ahora con mucho esfuerzo ya tienen tres vacas.  De las vacas obtiene leche para el consumo de la familia. Sus hijos trabajan en una finca cercana y aportan para los gastos del hogar y en los días libres le ayudan al señor Máximo en las labores de la siembra del café y cacao. Los cables de la electricidad pasan a más de una hora de distancia; es muy difícil que se amplíe la red eléctrica a su comunidad. Actualmente él, su esposa e hijos usan focos con pilas para iluminarse. Desean el crédito para comprar un pequeño sistema solar y así poder realizar mejor sus labores en el hogar y más seguridad.
texts.en:
Máximo, 45, lives in a rural community in Matagalpa with his wife and two children.  He’s a small coffee and cacao grower.  A short time ago his wife was the beneficiary of a community help program wherein she was given a cow.  Now, with much effort they have three cows.  From the cows they get milk for family consumption.  His children work in a nearby farm and contribute to household expenses and in their days off help Máximo with the coffee and cacao chores.  

The electric cables are more than an hour away so it’s very unlikely that the electric grid will reach his community.  Currently he, his wife and his children use battery-powered light bulbs for illumination.  They want the loan in order to buy a small solar system so that they can do their household chores better and for more security.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambasuren, 28 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She has been working as an accountant at a private business entity since 2012. Her husband is a crane operator at a building company. Their six-year-old son goes to kindergarten. 

Byambasuren is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase an electric car for personal use. The main reason for choosing an electric car is that electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities. This is because they produce no harmful pollution, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power.  

Purchasing the automobile will save time for traveling to work and can be beneficial for many occasions. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy materials and equipment needed in landscaping. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy materials and equipment such as rakes, shovels, brooms, edgers and other items needed in landscaping. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn dreams to have more customers and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and equipment, such as rakes, shovels, brooms, edgers and other items needed in landscaping.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es: Jeannette, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está soltera,  vive con su hijo,  padres y hermanos, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y materiales y pagar mano de obra en la reparación a la vivienda, y de esta manera eliminar algunas entradas de agua a la vivienda en el periodo de lluvia que ya casi inicia y así poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su familia mejoré su calidad de vida y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jeannette, 30, is single living with her son, parents and siblings who are her greatest priority.  She intends to use the loan to buy lumber and supplies and to pay labor costs to repair the house and eliminate leaks before the rainy season starts so she can offer her son and family better quality of life.

With this purchase she intends to do good quality improvements on her house and that her family improves their quality of life and to take advantage of the low prices of some materials that are of good quality.

This is her first Fudecosur loan.  She’s had no previous loans in state banks and Fudecosur offered her the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more stock of rice and other products for his business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina. Her previous loan was a big help not just in her business but also in the education of her children and in their household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelina dreams that her success in business will continue and that her family will live a happy and peaceful life. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as well as in her family's expenditures. She is a widow and that is why she is working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Amarbayar

texts.en: Mr. Amarbayar, 26 years old, lives with his wife, son and mother-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a welder for a private business for three years and during summer time, his work load increases. His wife is still unemployed and looks after her four-year-old son at home. His mother-in-law has retired from work and gets a state pension. Using his previous loan, he has purchased an automobile, which runs on natural gas. Now he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam to make an extension to his deteriorated old house. The extension will enable the family to burn less coal thus releasing less pollutants into the air and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to build a house extension

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the spare parts and accessories needed in her jeepney. The loan also helped in the education of her child. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and pay for the education of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams to have another jeepney and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. The loan also helped in the education of her children and in their everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a variety store and a tailoring business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their van unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and pay for her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth dreams to have additional units of van. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Altanzaya

texts.en: Mrs. Altanzaya, 42 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a barber shop for ten years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this business. Her husband has been rendering taxi services to the local people and is quite expert at picking up costumers, taking shortcuts and driving fast. Both of their children go to high school. Since her opening of her barbershop, she has not made any updates to her barbershop and this has had a negative impact on business. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase cosmetics, electric clippers and a chair. By doing so, her barbershop will attract greater numbers of customers and satisfy their needs. The borrower is a hardworking individual who cares greatly about her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase barbershop tools

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
This is Yvonne, 33, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronelo, a construction worker. She is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Yvonne maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. She also has an RTW business and she also sells pork and chicken. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 60,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Yvonne hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 44-year-old married mother of 4 children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a food market business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and seasonings to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his coffee plants

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
This is Elisa. She previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Elisa would like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elisa hopes to have other sources of income, and she dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: El Sr. Lucio  tiene 47 años, casado con 7 hijos que son de las edades, todos ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, el se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos según la temporada,  como billeteras, monederos de distintos   en esta ocasión el está vendiendo gafas de sol, vende de manera ambulante visitando calles barrios y mercados ofreciendo sus productos,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Lucio  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería de gafas al por mayor,  el Sr. Lucio  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención y comprando variedad de productos, el Sr. Lucio    se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Lucio is 47-years-old, has 7 children that are of different ages and all of them are of school age.  He works in the retail trade, offering a variety of products depending on the season such as wallets, purses for different occasions, and sunglasses. He sells by walking around streets and neighborhoods offering his products.

This loan is the first loan through the institution. Lucio will use the loan to purchase merchandise of wholesale glasses. Lucio faces obstacles to his business such as the demand for new products. He is going to use the benefit in a better way and buy a variety of products. Lucio is happy and grateful with the institution for the help provided in obtaining a loan.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sunglasses

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok is 56 years old, married to a local farmer, and a mother of eight children. She manages one and a half hectare of rice paddy, and she also plants soybeans to sell for extra income. She and her spouse have been patiently growing rice and soybeans for over 30 years.

In the early-coming rainy season, Pok needs to apply the farm supplies to her crops at the right time and in a suitable manner so that she can improve her production and enjoy a better harvest than last year. She would like to grow more than she does right now, but she needs enough capital to sustain it with a sufficient supply of pesticides, herbicides, and seeds. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy these supplies for the maintenance of the rice and soybean fields.

loans.use: to buy a sufficient supply of pesticides, herbicides, and seeds.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is receiving another loan of PHP 15,000 in order to buy ingredients for making barquillos and ice cream. The ice cream business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide for Helen and her family with enough of an increase to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
Juana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo prestamo porque necesita mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su actividad; este le permitira comprar  maíz, condimentos y  preparación para la elaboración de pupusas, una mesa con sillas para la clientela; esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos económicos  y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Juana is in need of a new loan because she needs more capital so that she can keep investing in her work. This will allow her to purchase corn, spices, the preparations for the creation of pupusas (traditional dish made of corn tortilla), and a chair with seats for her clients. This will help her to improve her income and provide a better quality of life to her family. 

The economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase corn, spices, the preparations for the creation of pupusas (traditional dish made of corn tortilla), and a chair with seats for her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his coffee crops

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has an internet cafe in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Marissa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy supplies for her internet cafe.

Marissa has sustained her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 50 years old, and a widowed mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Melinda has sells seafood in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to her customers.

Melinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en: Mr. Nyamaa, 38 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been rendering transportation services to the local people for a long time and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. His wife works at a supermarket as a cashier. Their daughter teaches at the high school. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase felt and hardwood floors in order to replace deteriorated old felt and floors. As a result, the family will begin to burn less coal for heating as new felt will better protect them from winds and snows.

loans.use: to purchase felt and hardwood floors.

loans.name: Tsogzoldorj

texts.en:
Mr.Tsogzoldorj is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ger in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife, Zolzaya, is 36 and has been operating a clothing retail business in a rental stall of the local market since 2005. His two daughters both attend the local school. 

Tsogzoldorj has been helping his wife to run their family business. He is a talented craftsman, making wooden items and helping his friends and relatives to fix their furniture and other stuff. He is now planning to make a business and start providing carpentry services to order since he is well-known in his work. He is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of inventory to produce wooden products and sell to local customers.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory to produce wooden products and sell to local customers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace. She previously took out a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were used for her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Grace dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and study the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng is 28 years old and married with two young children. She earns a living by farming rice in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. Her husband, Koy, works in construction in the area around the province after working on their rice farm to earn additional income.

Due to their transportation needs, Meng is borrowing a KHR 1,000,000 loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting. This purchase will help her husband cut down his traveling fees and get to work on time. She promises to pay back her loan in full and will keep improving her rice production to achieve profits for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia works really hard for her family. Her husband, a mason, is helping her in providing for their family. Her previous loans have been of great help both to her sewing business and their household.

Amalia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional supplies of raw materials such as fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amalia hopes to find a better stall for her business and dreams that her children will each have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Melva successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Melva's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, está soltero y no tiene  familiares en el  extranjero. El, se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante y a la carpintería que son sus fuentes de ingresos para salir adelante, lo realiza de las 6:00am a 4:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar prendas de vestir tales como: camisas, pantalones, faldas, entre otros; esta inversion le ayudara a obtener variedad de productos y mayor inventario para las ventas.
Su sueño es mejor su negocio y optimizar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is single and does not have relatives abroad. He works in the sale of clothes and in carpentry. With his income he is able to get ahead. He works from 6:00am to 4:00pm. 

The loan that he is requesting will allow him to purchase clothing garments such as shirts, pants, skirts, and other items.  This investment will help to obtain a variety of products and more inventory to sell. 

His dream is to improve his business and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and clean his property

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak (in the photo), age 30, is a high school teacher. Besides teaching, he also supplements his income by working as a security guard. He has been married for three years and has just one young son. He lives in a Phnom Penh suburb with his elderly mother and one sister, who is a garment worker. His wife is also a garment worker. 

Vannak wants to continue his studies by getting a bachelor's degree in at a university in Phnom Penh. He has decided to apply for an education loan. He will use the loan to pay for his third year of school, where he is majoring in Khmer Literature.

Vannak expects that he will graduate in 2015 and get a salary of about $400 a month.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for the repair of his wife's car to continue providing taxi services.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business and for her household expenses and her children's education. She has had this business for six years. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration by studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Fernanado

texts.es: El Sr. Fernando tiene 40 años casado con 6 hijos mayores de 15 años que se encuentran estudiando, el  se dedica a la actividad de la pesca  el vive en una isla del lago Titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Fernando va a usar este préstamo para compra de redes para usar en la pesca, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar la pesca e incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Fernando enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener una mejor producción y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando en su trabajo ya que este es su único ingreso para mantener a su familia, el Sr. Fernando es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Fernando is 40-years-old, is married, and has 6 children older than 15 who are studying.  He works as a fisherman. He lives on an island in the lake Titicaca in the tourist center in the department of La Paz.  This area offers crafts of reed and wool. The majority of the inhabitants of the island work as fisherman or work in tourism. 

This loan is his first with the institution. Fernando will use the loan to purchase fishing nets. His reason for requesting this loan is to increase the fishing yield and increase his capital. Fernando faces challenges to his business including having a better production. He will use the benefits to continue improving his work since this is his only source of income to support his family. Fernando is a hardworking person and he feels happy for the opportunity provided.

loans.use: to purchase nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: 3.2.312.3.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Ngọc is 38 years old and married with two children. She works in agriculture, growing vegetables, and has been in this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

Ngọc is the group leader of the 3.2.312.3.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2010, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from this organization.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns Ngoc is a lack of capital. With her business profits, she hopes for her children to do well in school, to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, age 29, is a married woman. She has two children, one of whom attends school. Mwanamisi owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamisi operates a car wash business. Her potential customers are car owners and [operators of] public vehicles. She faces stiff competition from other car washers. With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase washing detergents and spraying water pipes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase washing detergents and spraying water pipes for her car wash business.

loans.name: Alissone

texts.pt:
Sr. Allison de 44 anos de idade, casado vive na sua propria casa e tem 07 filhos dos quais 4 sao independente e 3 estao a frequenta a escola no ensino secunadario. Ele è Negociante e tem uma banca no mercado, actividade que vem exercendo ha mais de 5 anos
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para compra de produtos ( arroz, oleo, feijao, cerveja, acucar, refresco, caldo, farinha de milho eoutros diversos da 1a necessidade para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
texts.en:
Alissone is 44 years old and married. He lives in a house that he owns and he has seven children. Four of his children are independent and three of them attend high school. He's a merchant and owns a stall at the market, a business he has been running for over five years.
The current loan will be used to purchase merchandise (rice, cooking oil, beans, beer, sugar, refreshments, broth, corn flour and other assorted household staples) in order to increase his business volume.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (rice, cooking oil, beans, beer, sugar, refreshments, broth, corn flour and other assorted household staples) in order to increase his business volume.

loans.name: Jairo Andres

texts.es: Jairo de 20 años de edad, vive en la hermosa ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico, conocida nacionalmente como la arenosa. Es un joven en estado civil soltero; tiene un negocio de servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, el cual lo brinda a vecinos en el barrio y de barrios circunvecinos. Los clientes alquilan las lavadoras de Jairo por horas, le llaman por teléfono solicitándole el servicio; él les lleva las lavadoras hasta su propia casa, y después de transcurrido el tiempo convenido del alquiler, las pasa a retirar. El pago de estos servicios es de contado. Estos servicios los brinda a sus clientes todos los días, desde la siete (7) de la mañana hasta las siete (7) de la noche. Los gastos del negocio, son solo por mantenimiento y compra de repuestos. Su negocio nació hace un (1) año, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos, por la muerte de su abuela quien era la que aportaba mayormente para los gastos de la familia. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de más lavadoras, para brindar un mejor servicio en cuanto a tiempo de respuesta, y a nuevos clientes que solicitan el servicio. Con esta inversión aspira aumentar sus ingresos y utilidades, y en un futuro tener su propia casa y familia.
texts.en: Jairo, who is 20 years old, lives in the beautiful city of Barranquilla, in the Atlantic department, which is known nationally as "The Sandy." He is a young single man. He has a service business of renting washing machines, which he offers to neighbors in his neighborhood and in surrounding neighborhoods. The customers rent the washing machines from Jairo by the hour. They call him by telephone asking for the service. He takes the washing machines to their houses, and after the agreed-upon rental time has passed, he goes to pick them up. The payment for these services is in cash. He offers this service to his customers every day, from 7 in the morning to 7 at night. The expenses of the business are only for maintenance and buying parts. His business was born a year ago due to the need to generate income because of the death of his grandmother, who was the one who contributed mostly to the family expenses. This is his first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he will use it to buy more washing machines, to offer better service with regard to the time for repairs and to new customers who request the service. With this investment he hopes to increase his income and profits and in the future to have his own house and family.

loans.use: to buy more washing machines to offer better service.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 46 years old. He lives in the small village of Martvili District with his mother, who has a retirement pension. 

Several times, without success, Ramaz has requested loans from local financial institutions to start a family business. His requests have been rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
 
The family’s only source of income is from agricultural activities. Specifically, the family has a milking cow, a calf and two pigs as well as a plot of land, where nut trees are grown. 

Ramaz also has a mill and gets orders to grind maize. His earnings are hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo, this family belongs in the “subsistence poor” category. 

Ramaz has been approved for a loan from Credo to start a family business. He was approved for the loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to poor people in rural areas, who do not have access to credit.
