The rural poor are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes.
 
With his loan, Ramaz will begin trading in cereals, fruits and vegetables. This will increase the family's income. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trade in cereals, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Sr.  Jose de 60 anos de idade, casado vive na sua propria casa e tem 2 filhos, todos maiores de idade que ainda sao dependentes dos seus pais.Ele è Pensionista Militar.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para compra de material de construcao (ferro, blocos, cimento, janelas, portas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a sua casa. Alem de comprar material de construcao sera aplicado para compra de bens (mesa com 4 cadeiras e um congelador.)
texts.en:
Jose is 60 years old and married. He lives in a house that he owns and he has two children, all of whom are adults who still depend on their parents. He's a military pensioner.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (iron, bricks, cement, windows and doors) and to pay for labor in order to continue building his house. Aside from buying construction supplies, it will also be used to purchase goods (a table with four chairs and a freezer).

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (iron, bricks, cement, windows and doors) and to pay for labor in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Faquihi

texts.pt:
Faquihi tem 50 anos de idade e vive maritalmente há 32 anos. Tem 6 filhos, 3 dos quais estudam e os restantes são maiores de idade.
Faquihi é ourives e com o valor do credito vai comprar ouro em pó e prata na zona centro do pais para fazer brincos, anéis, fios e mascotes para o seu negocio.
No futuro espera oficializar sua relação casando e terminar a construção de sua casa. 
Diz que vai pagar pontualmente para voltar a solicitar outros empréstimos para realizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Faquihi is 50 years old and has been married for 32 years. He has six children, three of whom study, and the others are adults. Faquihi is a goldsmith. With the amount of the loan he'll purchase gold dust and silver in the central area of the country in order to make earrings, rings, chains and other types of jewelry for his business.
In the future he hopes to make his marriage official and to finish building his house.
He states that he'll repay the loan in a timely fashion so that he can request more loans again in order to achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase gold dust and silver in order to make jewelry for selling.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
Jorge nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 32 anos, é casado e pai de 2 filhos que vão a Escola. Responsabiliza-se também pela sua mãe enviando lhe um valor de 500mt em cada 3 meses.
Trabalha na área da segurança há mais de 5 anos, em  Boane. Por essa razão optou por solicitar este crédito para abrir um negócio para sua esposa na tentativa de aumentar a renda familiar, uma vez que trabalha longe da família. Este é seu 8º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir produtos de 1º necessidade (farinha de milho, açúcar, feijão, óleo, etc) para revender. Dos 7 empréstimos anteriores, 2 foram para habitação e 5 para o comércio.
Futuramente pretende iniciar a construção de uma capoeira para a criação de pintos. Esta confiante que irá pagar antes do tempo para aceder a mais créditos.
texts.en:
Jorge comes from the district of Namaacha. He's 32 years old and married, and has two children who attend school. He's also responsible for his mother, sending her 500mt every three months.
He has been working in security for over five years in Boane. For that reason he opted to request this loan so he can start a business for his wife. He's trying to increase their family income, since he works far away from his family. This is his 8th loan with Hluvuku and with it he intends to purchase products that are household staples (corn flour, sugar, beans, cooking oil, etc.) for re-selling. Out of his 7 previous loans, 2 were for personal housing expenses and 5 were for retail.
In the future he intends to start building a coop for raising chicks. He's confident that he'll repay the loan ahead of schedule so he can apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (corn flour, sugar, beans, cooking oil, etc.) for re-selling.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la hermosa ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico, conocida a nivel nacional como la “Arenosa” ó “Curramba la Bella”. Es casada, con dos hijas de veintidós (22) y veinticuatro (24) años de edad respectivamente. Su negocio es de confección de vestidos, camisas, pantalones y arreglo de ropa. Este oficio lo brinda de contado y a crédito a clientes del barrio y personas referidas; todos los días de seis (6) de la mañana a nueve (9) de la noche. Hace las compras de sus insumos en almacenes del mercado en el centro de la ciudad. Aprendió esta actividad de sus hermanas mayores, desde hace treinta (30) años, y el negocio lo inició desde el año 2003, es decir, hace diez (10) años. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de una fileteadora, con el objetivo de ofrecer otros servicios y productos con mayor calidad. Sus metas son: Tener un taller con operarias, y que sus hijas terminen sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Maria, 55 years old, lives in the beautiful city of Barranquilla, Atlántico Department. It is known nationally as the "Sandy" place or "Curramba the beautiful." She is married and has two children ages 22 and 24. She has a business making dresses, shirts, and pants in addition to clothing repairs. She takes both cash and credit from her customers in the neighborhood and those referred to her. She works from six in the morning until nine at night every day. She sells her items in shops in the market in the city center. She learned this skill from her older sisters over 30 years ago. She started the business in 2003, which was 10 years ago.

This is her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will apply to buying an overlock sewing machine to offer other services and products at a higher quality. Her goals are to have a workshop with employees and have her daughters finish their higher education.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine to offer other services and products at a higher quality

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Karina Maritza

texts.es:
Karina, vive con su esposo de 33 años de edad, sus hijos de 7 y 10 años, todos dependen del negocio. Ella, se dedica a la venta de tamales y otros, el oficio lo realiza desde hace 10 años y lo trabaja todos los días de 5:00am a  3:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar maíz, leña, ollas, hoja de huerta, entre otros; esto le ayudara a tener más inventarios y mercaderías para poder trabajar más, mejorar las ganancias y salir adelante.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Karina lives with her husband, who is 33, and their children, ages 7 and 10. Everyone depends on the business. She sells tamales and other items, work that she has been doing for 10 years. She works every day from 5 am to 3 pm.

The loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy corn, firewood, pots, and leaves for wrapping tamales, among other items. This will help her to have a greater inventory and supplies to be able to work more, improve her earnings, and advance.

Her dream is to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, pots, and leaves to wrap tamales, among other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 53 años de edad, es divirciada y vive en compañía de sus 02 hijos de 25 años y 18  años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en la casa que le heredó su padre. Juana se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas, como tallarines, arroz chaufa, pollos broster y otros,  todo lo prepara durante el día, para luego instalar su puesto de venta en el frontis de su casa , desde donde atiende a todos sus clientes.  Realiza está actividad hace más de 20 años y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda  de su hermana quien la apoya en la preparación y atención de los clientes, pagandolé por sus servicios. Le gusta su actividad  porque  le permite contar con un ingreso económico  para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, además le gusta cocinar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará mesas y sillas , además de utensilios para la cocina como platos, cucharas, tenedores, vasos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Juana, who is 53 years old, is divorced and lives with her two children ages 25 and 18, in the house that she inherited from her father. Juana prepares and sells food such as pasta, fried rice, broasted chicken, and other dishes. She prepares everything during the day, then sets up her sales stand at the front of her house, where she serves all her customers. She has been doing this for more than 20 years, and up to now she has had the help of her sister, who assists her with the preparation and serving the customers. She pays her for her services. She likes her business because it allows her to have an income to be able to pay the household expenses. Furthermore, she likes to cook. This is her fourth loan from Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue forward. In addition, she promises to make her payments in a punctual manner.

With the 1000 PEN she is applying for, she will buy tables and chairs, in addition to utensils for the kitchen such as plates, spoons, forks, and glasses, among other items.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and utensils for the kitchen, such as plates, spoons, and forks, among other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies for making pottery

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Battsetseg, 29 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling vegetables and fruits to local people at an outdoor market since 2010. Her husband has been transporting goods between cities using his own truck on contract with private business entities. They grow vegetables on their plot of land. However, due to a lack of cash, they can't afford to purchase enough seeds and install an irrigation system. Therefore she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to cover the cost associated with growing vegetables such as potatoes, cabbage and carrots. Growing vegetables not only contributes to the family income but also to the environment by turning carbon dioxide into oxygen. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for her children and husband.

loans.use: to cover the cost of growing vegetables

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ana hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

Footnote: Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and modified the jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, which is open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly the Philippines.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 5 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe BENKORO vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et nucléaires avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Kolondieba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce: restauration et vente de canaris. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame RAMATOU (2ème à droite sur la photo) est l’une des vendeuses de pots du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour la confection de pots (transport d’argile, achat de fagots et frais de main d’œuvre)
Elle s’approvisionne au bord du fleuve et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame RAMATOU compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Benkoro Group is made up exclusively of married women, who average 39 years of age and 5 children. They all live in traditional and nuclear families in Kolondieba (a town and prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali). They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community and marriage.

The members of the group are retailers, restaurateurs, or sell "canaris" (clay pots). In order to bolster their working capital, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their second solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Ramatou (second woman on the left in the photograph) is one of the pot sellers of the group. She intends to use her loan to manufacture clay pots (transporting clay, buying firewood bundles, and covering labor expenses).

She gets her supplies on the riverside and retails for cash and on credit, at her home and at the market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

Thanks to this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 12'500 (ca US$ 25) to be in part reinvested in her business, and in part used to help her husband cover some family expenses.

loans.use: to manufacture clay pots known as "canaris"

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Salvacion successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Salvacion's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: This time, for her fifth cycle loan, Monina is borrowing a new loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. Her business, which was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA, continues to provide for her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mogokanado Antie Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 4 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe MOGOKANADO ANTIE vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et nucléaires avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Kolondieba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
 Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce: vente  de pots (canaris...). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame FATOUMATA (1ère à gauche sur la photo) est l’une des vendeuses de pots du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour la confection de pots (transport d’argile, achat de fagots et frais de main d’œuvre)
Elle s’approvisionne au bord du fleuve et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame FATOUMATA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mogokanado Antie Group is made up exclusively of married women, who average 44 years of age and 5 children. All five live in traditional and nuclear families in Kolondieba (a town and prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali). They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community and marriage.

The members of the group are retailers: they sell "canaris" (clay pots). In order to bolster their working capital, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Fatoumata (first woman on the left in the photograph) is one of the pots sellers of the group. She intends to use her loan to manufacture clay pots (transporting clay, buying firewood bundles, and covering labor expenses).

She gets her supplies on the riverside and retails for cash and on credit, at her home and at the market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

Thanks to this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 7'500 (ca US$ 15) to be in part reinvested in her business, and in part used to help her husband cover some family expenses.

loans.use: to manufacture clay pots known as "canaris"

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 47 лет, не замужем. Образование-среднее. Гульмира более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она имеет большой опыт в животноводстве и знает всю теорию по разведению скота. Бизнес начала с суммы 5000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день прибыль ее достигла до 10000 сом (KGS). Гульмира трепетно и с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. В хозяйстве имеет 4 коровы, 14 коз и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего увеличения скота Гульмира обратилась в наш микрофинансовый банк "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в сумме 100000 сом (KGS) на разведение крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вкладывать в увеличение поголовья скота и в будущем хочет построить дом.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 47 years old and not married. She has secondary education. Gulmira has worked with livestock breeding for more than 10 years. She has long experience in this area and knows all the theory of breeding livestock. She started her business with an amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Currently her monthly income has reached 10,000 som (KGS). Gulmira deals with her business eagerly and responsibly. The farm currently has four cows, 14 goats and 10 sheep. 

With an aim to further increasing the number of livestock, Gulmira turned to our microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the breeding of cattle, sheep and goats. Gulmira plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock. In the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for breeding

loans.name: Ainakan

texts.ru: Айнакан, 54 года, замужем, имеет 1 сына в возрасте 14 лет. Образование-средне-специальное. По профессии бухгалтер. В настоящее время работает библиотекарем в местной школе. С 1998 года решила заняться животноводством. Благодаря своему решительному характеру и упорству развила свое домашнее хозяйство, и на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 4 овцы. Бизнес начинала с 3000 сом (KGS) и увеличила прибыль до 17000 сом (KGS) ежемесячно. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Сын учится в школе. В целях дальнейшего развития своего небольшого хозяйства Айнакан обратилась к нам в Микрофинансовый банк "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом, в сумме 100000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнакан планирует вкладывать в развитие хозяйства и в будущем планирует дать высшее образование сыну.
texts.en:
Ainakan is 54 years old, married and has one son of the age of 14. She has vocational secondary education, and is an accountant by profession. Currently she works as a librarian at the local school. In 1998 she decided to work with livestock breeding. Thanks to her decisive character and persistence, she developed her farm and currently it has two cows, two steers and four sheep. She started this business with 3,000 som (KGS) and has increased monthly the income to 17,000 som (KGS). Her husband helps her with the business. Her son goes to school. 

With an aim to further develop her small business, Ainakan turned to us in the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS), for increasing the number of livestock. Ainakan plans to invest the income from the loan in developing the business. In the future she plans to provide her son with higher education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and weed his field.

loans.name: Mavludakhon

texts.ru:
Мавлудахон целеустремленная женщина, всегда усердно работающая для улучшения условий жизни. Она замужем и проживает с мужем и тремя детьми в районе Дж.Руми. Ей 43 года. В последние годы Мавлудахон работала в должности повара в столовой. Теперь она хочет открыть свой собственный семейный бизнес. Ее интересует овцеводство. Со слов Мавлудахон овцы неприхотливы и их разведение не трудоёмкое. И поскольку овцы пастбищные животные с кормами проблем у нее не будет. К тому же это удивительное животное дает больше видов продукции, чем любой другой крупный или мелкий домашний скот. В частности: мясо, жир, молоко, шерсть, меховая продукция, каракуль, кожа. Поэтому овцы всегда в спросе, что обеспечит ей стабильный доход.  
Все члены семьи Мавлудахон будут помогать ей в ведении нового бизнеса. Мавлудахон запрашивает кредит для закупа 4-х голов овец. С полученной прибыли она хочет осуществить свою мечту - женить своего старшего сына. Мавлудахон верит и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavludakhon is a purposeful woman, always working heartily to improve her living conditions. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in the J.Rumy region. 

In the latest years Mavludakhon has worked as a cook at a cafe. Currently she would like to open her own family business. She is interested in sheep breeding. In her own words, sheep are unpretentious and breeding them is not laborious. And because sheep are grazing animals she won't have any problems with fodder. Besides, this wonderful animal gives more types of products than other types of livestock. In particular: Meat, fat, milk, wool, fur products, astrakhan fur and leather. Therefore sheep are always in demand, in order to support a stable income. 

All members of Mavludakhon's family will help her with managing the new business. Mavludakhon requests a loan for the purchase of four sheep. With the income she would like to realize her dream - to marry away her eldest son. Mavludakhon trusts in and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for starting a sheep breeding business

loans.name: Orlino

texts.en:
Orlino is 27 and married. He lives with his partner in the Ugad province of Isabela. He works hard as a farmer to support his family. He grows crops on a plot that is near the house where he lives. Farming, which he learned from his parents many years ago, was his first job and has allowed him to earn enough money to help pay for household expenses.

Orlino has 10 years of agricultural experience and now needs a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers for the best harvest season of the year and also to plow other sections and plant more crops. He dreams of building a house to improve his family's standard of living, as they still live with his parents.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers for the best harvest season of the year and also to plow other sections and plant more rice.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Ma. Luisa successfully paid back her previous loan and now she's getting a new loan in order to expand her business.

NWTF is re-listing Ma. Luisa's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Milyn

texts.en:
Milyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general-store business in the Philippines.

Milyn has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Milyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mogoyankan Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 5 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe MOGOYANKAN vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et nucléaires avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Kolondieba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
 Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce: vente de de pots (canaris...). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame RAMATOU (au milieu sur la photo) est l’une des vendeuses de pots du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour la confection de pots (transport d’argile, achat de fagots et frais de main d’œuvre)
Elle s’approvisionne au bord du fleuve et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame RAMATOU compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Mogoyankan group is made up of 5 married women who live in traditional, nuclear families and have an average age of 29 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the town of Kolondieba (the prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and marriage. The group members are small retailers and sell pottery containers used for transporting water. They have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their 5th group loan cycle.

Ramatou (in the middle of the picture) is one of the group members who sells pots. She plans to use her loan to produce some pots (including spending money on the transportation of the clay, bundles of sticks and labour wages). She gets her supplies from the riverbank and makes her sales for cash or credit, door-to-door and at the market, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, Ramatou expects to make an average monthly profit of 10 500 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to support her husband with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy the materials necessary for making clay pots.

loans.name: Pepito

texts.en:
Pepito is a 54-year-old married man. He owns a small farm where he plants and harvests all sorts of crops, which he sells for a living. His wife is currently unemployed, which means that the farm is their only source of financial support. 

Pepito decided to contact ASKI because he needs to maximize his profit in order to provide a healthy life for his family. In fact, he will be using the loan in order to purchase seeds and raw materials that will help him improve and enhance his output. As for the future, Pepito wishes to expand the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and raw materials that would help him improve and enhance his output.

loans.name: Sigija I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SIGIJA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIMPIALA I, un des villages de la Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  FANTA LAMINE  1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sigija I group are married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Zimpiala I, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Kolondieba, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan from the institution. The previous loan has been correctly repaid.

Fanta Lamine, standing on the left of the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 2 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold at the village market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 145 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay labour wages.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ambulant business selling foods in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft-drinks, cigarettes, fruits, and other groceries. She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, cigarettes, fruits and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is the married mother of 3 children, all of whom go to school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water and her challenges are food and fees for the children. 

She operates a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of price fluctuations in her business, and dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With this loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 53-year-old, married mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsa has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, sugar, detergent and other miscellaneous items.

Elsa has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, sugar, detergent, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four daughters. Her husband owns an artificial jewelry shop, which is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklace, rings, and bracelets. However due to lack of expenses he finds it difficult. Therefore, Noreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase artificial jewelry for her husband's shop. This will help him to increase his net income and savings. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business.

loans.use: to purchase variety of jewellery for the shop that includes bangles, necklace, rings, and bracelets.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, situated at the slopes of Mt.Kenya, a a very fertile land for agribusiness.He has practiced mixed farming for 4 years. His sources of income are tea leaves, coffee, and bananas. Another source of income is motorcycle transportation.

He requested Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 30,000 KES to invest  in a water tank to store water for his farm work. This will help boost his crop production and thus increase his yield and bring in more income. This new income will improve his family's living standards. The challenges he faces are pests and diseases.

In five years, he aspires to buy a pick-up for business purposes.

Julius says that Juhudi Kilimo has enabled him to fight poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Karshiboy

texts.ru:
Каршибой женатый мужчина, отец пятерых детей.  Он  занимается откормом и разведением скота с молодых лет, еще в детстве он помогал отцу в животноводстве.   Теперь сам с сыновьями занимается этим делом.  Раньше в советские времена он работал на ферме, поэтому имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Кроме животноводства у Каршибоя есть участок земли, где он выращивает лук, морковь, помидор.   Его жена и невестки тоже помогают ему. Когда Каршибой  с сыновьями занят сельскими работами, его жена и невестки присматривают за скотом, доят молоко, и производят из молока  кисломолочные продукты такие как кефир, творог и сливочное масло. 
  У Каршибоя летом почти нету свободного времени, с раннего утра он привозит на рынок свой урожай овощей и  сдает оптом торговцам.
 В данное время Каршибой хочет увеличить поголовье скота и с этой целю он обратился в организацию Арванд. Он очень рад, что благодаря кредитованию он сможет  увеличить  поголовье  скота.
texts.en: Karshiboy is a married man and father to five children. He has spent his time raising and breeding cattle since he was a child when he helped on his father's farm. Now he and his sons are farmers. Before, in Soviet times, he worked on a farm, so he has lots of experience in this field. In addition to working with livestock, Karshiboy has a plot of land where he grows onions, carrots, and tomatoes. His wife and daughter help him. While Karshiboy and his sons are busy farming his wife and daughter look after the cattle; they milk the cows and produce dairy products from the milk such as yogurt, cottage cheese, and butter. Karshiboy is very busy in the summer and therefore goes to the market early in the morning to deliver the harvest of vegetables and trade with wholesale merchants. At this time Karshiboy wants to grow his herd and for this purpose he applied to Arvand. He is very glad and thankful for the loan that will let him grow his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Christina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Christina would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mahjabeen's Group

texts.en:
Mahjabeen is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family; her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a furniture shop, which is the only source of income for his family. He manufactures variety of furniture including chairs, beds, tables, cupboards, etc. Presently, he wants to purchase wooden boards to manufacture furniture. However, due to lack of expenses he is unable to purchase it. 

Mahjabeen wants to help her husband to cover the cost; therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, as a member of a two-person lending group. The loan amount will be really helpful for her husband's business. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Mahjabeen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wooden boards to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en: Mr. Bayanmunkh is 40 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people using his own automobile for five years. Besides the taxi service, he has been selling mobile accessories at the trade center. He is the only one who generates income for the family. His wife is unemployed and stays at home. His daughter goes to high school. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, he can repair and insulate his house making his home a better place for living. More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, release less pollutants, and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials to renovate his home.

loans.name: Undraga

texts.en:
Undraga is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband, Nyamdash, drives a taxi and provides taxi service in town. Her older 2 daughters attend local schools, her son goes to the local kindergarten and her newborn baby daughter is 3 months old. 

Undraga has been staying home taking care of her newborn baby, and now has started working in her business again. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of construction materials to sell in her rented stall. She is a hardworking, welcoming and optimistic woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of construction materials to sell in her rental stall.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is single. She lives in her own house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business, operating from the market where neighbors and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase clothing materials and needles, and to repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and needles, and to repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
This is Lucila. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for her jeepney. She has this business for ten years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintain their jeepney. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucila hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work every week; she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity; however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Filipino.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 59 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en: Collins lives in Malindi, Kenya. The 28-year-old father of one runs a cyber cafe, and a tour and travel agency in Malindi. His business mostly targets tourists who visit the north coastal town. The cyber cafe deals with photocopying, internet and booking reservations for the tourists visiting the country. He met Milango through an employee, and he found this to be an opportunity to access credit to fund his business. He now seeks a loan to buy cartridges, printing and photocopy papers and refurbish his office. He has great ambition for this business, and he hopes that it will be the best in Malindi and the entire coastal region. The challenges he faces in business include competition and low season. Income from the loan will improve his living standards and educate his child.

loans.use: to buy cartridges, printing and photocopy papers for his internet cafe business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, salt, soap and other retail products.

loans.name: 05.01.05 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Chi is 54 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent. Another child is grown up.

In 2009, Chi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 05.01.05 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

She operates a food stall/restaurant selling nem chua (fermented/cured pork). She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to process the food for selling. Chi has been involved in this business for 9 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa. Her previous loan was a big help; not just in her business, but also in the education of her children and their household expenses. She and her husband, who is a driver, work together to provide for their family.  She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and poultry needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Theresa hopes to continuously expand her business and dreams to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feeds and poultry needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition for his children.

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en:
Shafqat, aged 50 years, is a very hardworking and active lady. She is a mother of six children. Her husband offers embroidery services, which is the only source of income for his family. His income is insufficient to run the household expenses. 

He does not have an embroidery machine; therefore, he is unable to fulfill the demands of customers on time. He has to take a lot of time to complete his work. He wants to purchase an embroidery machine; however, due to lack of finances he finds it difficult. 

Shafqat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase an embroidery machine to work more efficiently and professionally. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Shafqat hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family. For the past one year, she has operated a cosmetic-selling business, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of cosmetics for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya. This is a very fertile area for agriculture, located on the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has three children, one of whom is still in school. Joseph has been farming for 32 years. His main sources of income are tea leaves, maize, potatoes and bananas. The major challenge he faces is that of insecurity. 

He has requested a loan of KES.20,000 for purchasing pigs for the expansion of his income base. This will improve the family's living standards and Joseph will be able to provide a better education for the child who is in school. In five years, he will have opened up a pork house to supply the whole market.

He says that the interest rates for Juhudi funds are controlled and affordable.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land and build her own premises.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg is 40 years old and lives with her 2 children in an apartment in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Her daughter, Maral, and son, Manduul, both attend a local school. 

Ganchimeg has been growing organic vegetables on her plot of land and selling them in the local market since 1999. She has gained a lot of experience in the business and has maintained regular customers over the years. 

She is a hardworking, responsible and enthusiastic woman who now needs an additional investment of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in her rented stall. 

She covers her family's expenses from her business profits and dreams only of raising her children with a high and qualified education.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in her rented stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has been blessed with two children. She rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

For the past two years she has operated a food stall business selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: 07.01.10 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Đông is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. The other child is grown up.

She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. 

In 2010, Đông joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đông is the group leader of the 07.01.10  Phú Sơn 1 solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, Đông hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Amarjargal is a 37-year-old widow who lives with her mother, brother and 2 children in a Ger (Mongolian tent) in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her mother is retired and stays home, and requires constant care. Her brother works at a local mining company and her 2 children both attend a local school.

Amarjargal has been working in various types of businesses and started providing taxi service in 2012. She is now planning to build a small wooden house on her plot of land to open a grocery store and take care of her mother while she runs her business at home. 

She is now requesting 400,000 MNT to purchase medicines and other supplements for her mother. She is a hardworking, caring and open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and other supplements for her mother.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel lives in Changamwe area, in Mombasa, Kenya. He runs a grocery shop as well as a transport business. He has been in this business for seven years now. He seeks a loan to buy vegetables and fruits for his grocery shop. He knows of Milango from friends. He has had a previous Kiva loan, and he was able to pay back without challenges. He wants to be a supplier and wholesaler in five years' time. The challenges that he faces in his business include high transportation costs and bad debts. This father of two will use extra income to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is 35 years old. He is married and lives in his own house with his wife and daughters. He sells food products like milk, rice and sugar, among others. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 

He has had this business for 10 years. He started with his own capital. Upon seeing the good results that his sales generated for him, he decided to continue. He started in this field due to the need to have an occupation and to support his life partner with the household expenses. Also, he feels like a productive and independent person. He wishes to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that reflected in his family’s well-being.

He is now requesting 2,000 AZN. He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him in accessing the loan, which he needs to continue meeting his goals. He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client. He will use the requested loan to buy food products like milk, rice, sugar and vegetables for his   store. He has a good loan history. This is his 6th loan.

loans.use: to buy food products like milk, rice, sugar, and vegetables for his store.

loans.name: Irene Guadalupe

texts.es:
Irene, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y su esposo tiene 30 años de edad, disfruta de un hijo el cual tiene 5 años de edad. Ella, se dedica a la agricultura y pesca, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, fertilizantes, preparación de la tierra y para reparación de una red de pescar; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos, fortalecer más la agricultura, producir más y mejorar la pesca.
Su sueño es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Irene is twenty-six years old and is married.  Her husband is thirty years old, and she takes pride in her son, who is five years old.  She makes a living in agriculture and fishing, trades that she learned from her parents and which she takes part in every day.

The loan that she requires will allow her to buy manure and fertilizer, and to prepare the land.  It will also allow her to repair a fishing net.  This investment will help her to grow her income, strengthen her farming in producing more crops, and improve her fishing.

Her dream is to offer her family a better quality of life and to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to pay for manure and fertilizer, to prepare the land, and to repair a fishing net.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor resides in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a highly vegetative area located along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has four children. He has practiced farming for 25 years. His sources of income are tea leaves, fruits, coffee, maize, and vegetables. His other source of income is motorbike transport.

He wants to venture into egg production and thus has requested a loan of KES 60,000 for purchasing poultry. This will add to his income base. This will improve their living standards and thus better their feeding habits. 

The challenge he faces is inflation. In five years he will have bought at least 2 acres of land.

He says that Juhudi caters to small holder farmers, hence uplifting them.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Goldyboe

texts.en: Goldyboe is a 22-year-old university student here in Oroquieta City. He used to help his parents to earn the living of the entire family. He exclaims that once he receives the loan and join GDMPC, he promises to work very hard and make himself and everybody proud, especially my mother. He will also help other students in the future and contribute to the growth of the community.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for the current semester.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with one school-going child. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 4 years she has operated a tailoring business, operating from the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a married mother of 4 children, 3 of whom attend school and one is still young. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan has operated a boda boda (motorcycle taxi business) for the past three years; his customers are town dwellers and passersby. The rainy season is his major challenge due to the hardships of transportation in wet weather. 

He decided to join Yehu to access its loans. With this 50,000 KES loan, he wants to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike to increase his efficiency. He dreams of expanding this business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Ulises Francisco

texts.es:
Ulises, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo; este le permitirá comprar herramientas y material de electricidad industrial tales como: focos, terminales, fusibles, entre otros. 
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que incrementaron los ingresos y las utilidades las invierte  en la educación de sus hijos; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y está muy bien de salud junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Ulises requires a new loan because he needs more working capital.  This loan will allow him to buy tools and industrial electrical materials like: light bulbs, terminals, fuses, and other items.

The effect of the previous loan was favorable, since his income increased.  He invested these profits in the education of his sons.  Their economic conditions have improved and he and his family are in good health.

loans.use: to buy light bulbs, terminals, fuses, and other items.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a married man and has 2 children. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in his business.
 
With the Kes. 60,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 47 años de edad, está divorciada y vive en compañía de su hijo de 23 años de edad en una casa alquilada. Luzmila, se dedica a la confección de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene una taller en su hogar , en donde instaló varias máquinas de coser. Éste oficio lo aprendió en un centro educativo. Realiza ésta actividad hace más de 16 años, contando con la ayuda de una sobrina a quien paga por semana trabajada. Le gusta su actividad pues le permite desempeñarse en el oficio que le agrada y se siente a gusto elaborando nuevos diseños. Desea ampliar su negocio y en el futuro abrir una boutique en el mismo lugar. Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles comprará materiales de confección como  telas, hilos, botones, entre otros.
texts.en:
Luzmila is forty-seven years old and is divorced.  She lives in the company of her 23-year-old son in a home that they rent.  Luzmila makes a living in making clothing for women, men, and children.  She has a workshop in her home, where she has installed a few sewing machines.  She learned this trade from an educational trade center.  She has been involved in this work for more than sixteen years and has the help of her niece, who she pays weekly for her work.

She likes this activity because it allows her to do something that pleases her; she feels at ease creating new designs.  

She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, to open a boutique in this same place.  This is her sixth loan with Kiva and she feels thankful for the financial support that she receives in order to move ahead.  She also promises to pay her installments on time.  

With the requested amount of 1200 soles, she will buy dressmaking materials like fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials like fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has been blessed with four children. She rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. She has operated a food cafe business, selling food consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the Kes. 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and maize flour for the preparation of food for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and maize flour for the preparation of food for resale.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kes. 30,000 she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Arsena

texts.en:
Arsena is 48-year-old man from the Gurjaani district, East Georgia. He lives with his wife and 10 years old son, who goes to a local school. Arsena requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where peach trees are grown. Arsena looks after the trees and does all the agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested peaches are sold at local markets at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family as the income is only seasonally. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Arsena requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Arsena has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Arsena will purchase minibus. After the minibus is purchased he will begin trade with fruits and vegetables. He plans to purchase fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers and then resell at higher price. This will increase the income of his family. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will give him a chance to have regular income and thus will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and begin trade with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Mrs. Tuya, 28 years old, lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been making and selling clothes in her workshop for a long time and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her husband has a position as decorator at a building company. She is requesting a loan of 600000 MNT to purchase silk, cotton and textiles so that she can continue to make and sell her clothes without worrying about a shortage of raw materials. Income from clothes sales is major source of income for the family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase silk, cotton and textiles

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel de estado civil unida de hecho, cuenta con 23 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos y de ellos 1 esta estudiando, ella se dedica a una tienda de artículos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con una tienda pequeña y a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería para su tienda tales como: huevos, aceite, granos básicos, papel higiénicos, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros, espera en el futuro tener una tienda más grande y bien surtida. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 23 year old woman who is married in a civil union. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She runs a business selling everyday products which she began with a small store. She has five years of experience and relies on the support of her husband who makes a living selling goods. 

The group organized to request a loan that will be used to buy merchandise for her store including eggs, oil, basic grains, toilet paper, refreshments, snacks and other goods. She hopes to have a larger and better stocked store in the future. The rest of the members of the group also make a living in sales.

loans.use: to buy everyday products.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of three children, all of whom go to school . They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Mwanamisi has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
This is Joy. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as in their personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Joy dreams of having new products for her variety store to attract more customers. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir trabajando con su negocio; este le permitirá comprar diez quintales de maíz y más materia prima para realizar su actividad.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar los ingresos, ya que  le ha permitido apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y hacerle mejoras a la vivienda; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Ana has been presented with the need to opt for a new loan to continue working with her business. This will allow her to buy ten quintals of corn and more raw materials in order to work. Her previous loan helped her to increase her earnings, allowing her to support her children in school and make improvements to her home. Her economic conditions and family situation have been optimized.

loans.use: to buy ten quintals of corn and more raw material.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo prestamo porque requiere mas capital de trabajo; este  le permitirá comprar productos de la canasta básica tales como: frijoles, azúcar, arroz, aceite, sal, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a que sus ventas mejoren  y obtendrá mayores beneficios con las ganancias.
Las condiciones economicas han mejorado, asimismo las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: María needs a new loan because she is in need of more working capital, which will enable her to buy everyday items such as broad beans, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and salt, among others. This investment will help her increase her sales and earn more with the profits. Financially speaking, she is faring a bit better now, and her family leads a better life.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Samson Waran

texts.en:
Samson is a Finance Sudan Limited client. This is his third loan from Finance Sudan Limited. 

He is a businessman who specializes in selling retail goods like shoe polish, shoe brushes, combs, dry cells and many others. He has been in the business for about two years now, and the business is growing steadily.

He is borrowing another loan so that he can expand his business more and more and serve his customers well.

loans.use: To buy items like shoe polish, shoe brushes, hair combs, dry cells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nika

texts.en:
Nika is 20 years old. He lives in Gurjaani District, Kakheti Region with his mother and two brothers. Nika has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nika’s mother works as a sales lady and gets a small monthly income. The main source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where 85 peach trees are grown. Nika and his brothers do all the agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. As well as these activities, Nika works as an artisan and repairs damaged cars and motorbikes. He is a very hardworking young man and does his best to increase the income of his family. Nika requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Nika has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Nika will purchase piglets. After purchasing the piglets he will be able to start an animal husbandry business. As the piglets grow, he will sell some of them at a higher price. Other pigs will be used to start a new generation and expand the business for the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loa, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Nurgis

texts.en:
Nurgis, 39, is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a milk seller and his income is inadequate to meet the household expenses. He is living with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Since 2001, he has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases milk from the dairy farm and sells it in the market. 

Currently, he is in need of purchasing more milk from the farm to continue his business. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. So his wife, Nurgis, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his milk selling business, but will increase his net income and savings as well. 

Nurgis wants to provide a quality education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en:
Madinah is a 28-year-old single lady with one child. She currently lives in Masindi, Uganda. 

She was inspired by the love of serving the nation to be a teacher, which she has done for the last six years.

Like any other single, responsible mother, she has been able to use her low salary to educate her child and bought land to build a home. Her dream is to complete her house despite limited funds.

Madinah is requesting a loan to buy roofing materials like iron sheets.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials like iron sheets.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian has worked as a taxi driver for four years. 

He lives with his family and decided to start this business, thinking of his own progress and that of his family and his two children who go to school.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi. He appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is 26 years old, married and a mother of two. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells commodities such as flour, sugar and cooking oil. 

She knew Milango through friends and she decided to join with an aim of making savings. She learnt that she could access credit through Milango and that is why she seeks a loan to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. 

In five years time, she has ambitions of owning a wholesale shop. The challenge that she faces is lack of enough capital. The extra income that she will raise from the use of the loan will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop

loans.name: Astrid Ivette

texts.es:
Astrid es una  joven estudiante Obstetricia en una Universidad local
Astrid tiene 18 años estudia la carrera de Obstetricia porque desde muy niña siente vocación por la misma, su carrera dura 4 años de los cuales está cursando un año y medio, su mayor deseo es culminar su carrera con éxito y lograr ser una gran profesional, en el futuro quiere ejercer su carrera trabajando en una institución de salud prestigiosa. Astrid es una joven muy estudiosa y dedicada, gracias a este préstamo podrá pagar las pensiones de la universidad y otra parte para comprar algunos instrumentos que necesita para el desarrollo de su carrera. Astrid está muy agradecida a los inversionistas por obtener este préstamo ya que sin este apoyo no habría podido continuar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Astrid is a young student of obstetrics in a local university. She is 18 years old and is studying for a career in obstetrics because she has felt it was her vocation from the time she was very young. Her degree program will last 4 years, of which she has completed a year and a half. Her greatest desire is to finish her degree successfully and to be a great professional. 

In the future she wants to pursue her career by working in a prestigious health institution. Astrid is a very studious and dedicated young woman. Thanks to this loan she will be able to pay her university fees and also buy some tools that she needs to develop her career. Astrid is very grateful to the investors for giving her this loan, as without this support she would not be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay fees and buy materials

loans.name: Gerrard

texts.en:
Gerrard lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, situated along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has three children.

He has practiced farming for 28 years. His main source of income is tea leaves, maize, beans, and coffee. His extra source of income is a motor bike business.

He wants to venture into egg production and thus has requested a loan of KES 20,000 from Juhudi Kilimo for the purchase of poultry. This loan he says will bring in more food and money for the family.

The challenge he faces is that of the dry spell.

In five years, he will have ventured in the taxi business.

Gerrard says that the services offered by Juhudi Kilimo are cheap.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 29-year-old married man who lives in Haja, Yemen. 

He is a teacher, who provides students with good teaching. He works nearly all day and is happy to continue this career.
